definition: ἀρχίς, ίδος, ἡ, fem. of ἄρχων, IG 12(5).909, al. ( Tenos).

children.definition: chief baker, LXX Ge. 40.1 sq., Ph. 1.661.
chief staff-bearer, CIG 2987.21 ( Ephesus).
chief usher, POxy. 294.17 (i A. D.).
keeper of the sacred vestments, OGI 111.18 (ii B.C.), Sammelb. 4011.
commander-in-chief, LXX Jo. 5.15, al., J. AJ 6.11.9, etc.
ruler of a synagogue, Ev.Marc. 5.22, al., IG 14.2304, Ramsay Cities and Bishoprics No.559:—hence ἀρχι-συνᾰγωγέω, BCH 8.463 ( Thessalonica, ii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: master of a guild or company, IGRom. 1.782 ( Thrace), etc.
chief of the body-guard, LXX Es. 2.21, OGI 99.1 (ii B.C.), PTeb. 79.52 (ii B.C.), J. AJ 12.2.5.
keeper of records, ἀ. Αἰγύπτου OGI 707.6 ( Tyre, ii A. D.).
construction, Bito 61.2.

to be architect, chief constructor, or commissioner of works, Plu. Per. 13, Sosip. 1.16, OGI 656, etc.: c. acc., design, construct, τριακοντήρη ib. 39 (iii B. C.); βιβλιοθήκην Afric. Cest. Oxy. 412.67:— Pass., τὴν οἰκίαν . . εὖ ἠρχιτεκτονῆσθαι Thphr. Char. 2.12.
contrive, Ar. Pax 305, Fr. 195; supervise, direct, -τεκτονοῦντος τοῦ Πλάτωνος Phld. Acad.Ind. p.15M.
stroke of art, artifice, Luc. Asin. 25.
architecture, construction, LXX Ex. 35.32, Bito 49.2, Gal. 5.68.
of or for an ἀρχιτέκτων or his business and art, Pl. Plt. 261c; of persons, fit to be a master-builder, skilled in his art, Arist. Pol. 1282a3.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη or ἐπιστήμη) architecture, Sosip. 1.36.
master-art or science, which prescribes to all beneath it, as an ἀρχιτέκτων to his workmen, Arist. EN 1094a14, Metaph. 1013a14, al.; professional knowledge, Id. Po. 1456b11.
conduct of office of ἀρχιτέκτων, BCH 10.500 ( Pisidia).

chief-artificer, master-builder, director of works, τοῦ ὀρύγματος, τῆς γεφύρας, Hdt. 3.60, 4.87; opp. χειροτέχνης, Arist. Metaph. 981a30; opp. ἐργατικός, Pl. Plt. 259e; commissioner of works, IG 2.403, al., ib. 9(1).694.145 ( Corcyra), SIG 284.12 (Chios, from Erythrae), etc.; ἀ. τοῦ ναοῦ ib. 494.3 (Delph.); ἀ. ἐπὶ τὰ ἱερά IG 2.404.

children.label: b
children.definition: board of naval constructors, Arist. Ath. 46.1.

author, contriver, E. Cyc. 477; ἀ. κύριος τῆς ἡδονῆς Alex. 149.2; ἀ. τῆς ἐπιβουλῆς D. 56.11; τοῦ τέλους Arist. EN 1152b2; τοὺς ταῖς διανοίαις ἀ. τινός those that direct activities by thought, Id. Pol. 1325b23.

children.label: II
children.definition: manager of the state theatre and of the Dionysia, D. 18.28, IG 2.335.
chief toll-collector, chief-publican, Ev.Luc. 19.2.
president of a banquet ( triclinium), Ev.Jo. 2.9.
head-waiter, Hld. 7.27.
chief of the men-at-arms, Plu. Eum. 1.
chief minister, IG 14.914 (iii A.D.), BGU 21 iii 9 (iv A. D.):—also ἀρχυπηρέτης, Sammelb. 599.61, Ostr. 1538.
head of Jewish school, Just. Nov. 146.1.2. (Aram. pirḳā ‘lesson’.)
principal friend, dub.l. in J. AJ 7.9.6 (prob. ἀρχαῖον φίλον).
command a φρουρά, IG 9(2).1059 (Thess.): also in form ἀρχι-προυρέω, ib. 1058.
commandant of a φρουρά, Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1911.124 ( Gonnos).
hold office of ἀρχιφύλαξ (q.v.), OGI 565.12 ( Oenoanda); ἠρχιφυλακηκότα Λυκίων τοῦ κοινοῦ TAM 2.143 ( Lydae).
office of ἀρχιφύλαξ, OGI 566.17 ( Oenoanda):—written ἀρχι-φῠλᾰκεία, IGRom. 3.593 ( Sidyma).

commandant of φυλακῖται (q.v.), PRev.Laws 37.5 (iii B.C.), PHib. 1.73, PTeb. 5.142 (ii B.C.):—hence ἀρχι-φῠλᾰκῑτεία, ἡ, office of ἀ., ib. 27.22 (ii B.C.), and ἀρχι-φῠλᾰκῑτεύω, hold such office, PAlex. 9.4 ( iii B. C.(?)).
commandant of guards, in Egypt, PGiss. 9.13 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: official of the Lycian league, TAM 2.199 ( Sidyma).
chief of the φύλαρχοι, Zos. 3.22.
chief of a tribe, LXX De. 29.10(9).
leader of chorus, IG 12(2).484.20 (Mytil.).
son of a place-hunter, Com.Adesp. 84.

of the nature of a principle, Arist. Metaph. 999a2, APo. 86b38, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1085c, Theol.Ar. 8, al.: Comp., Alex.Aphr. Febr. 21, Simp. in Ph. 7.21: Sup., Alex.Aphr. Febr. 7, Dam. Pr. 52ter. Adv. -δῶς Procl. Inst. 65, Syrian. in Metaph. 3.23.
chief butler, IG 9(1).486 ( Thyrrheum), PTeb. 72.447 (ii B. C.).
grasping at office, Com.Adesp. 84.
hold office of ἄρχων, IPE 12.130.17 ( Olbia, ii/iii A. D.).
wish to be ruler, Sch. Ar. V. 342, Lyd. Mag. 1.28.
of an archon, πέλεκυς AP 9.763 tit. ( Jul.Aegypt.); ὑπηρεσία PGrenf. 2.82.15 (400 A.D.): generally, of a ruler, Corp.Herm. 1.25.
ex-archon, IG 14.756a ( Naples), cf. 1789.

definition: ἀρχοντίς, ίδος, ἡ, fem. of ἄρχων, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.177.8.

children.definition: leader, chief, εἷς δέ τις ἀρχὸς ἀνήρ Il. 1.144: c. gen., νηῶν 2.493; οἰωνῶν Pi. P. 1.7; ruler, Τειχιούσσης SIG 3d ( Milet., vi B. C.); πόλεως (opp. ἔτης), prob. in E. Fr. 1014.
ἀ. ἑῴας, = dux Orientis, ib. 14.1073 (iv A. D.).
SIG 56.26 ( Argos, v B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: the rectum, Hp. Aph. 5.58, Arist. HA 507a33, Theol.Ar. 51.
the anus, Hp. Haem. 2, Epid. 5.20.
IG 5(2).437 ( Megalop., ii B. C.), Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1917.2,10 ( Perrhaebia).
in which elections were held at Erineos, GDI 2030.
electoral college for the appointment of magistrates in Lycia, IGRom. 3.473.44.
belonging to Archytas, Iamb. Comm. Math. 7 ( -ιος cod.).

definition: ἄρχω, Ep. inf. ἀρχέμεναι Il. 20.154: impf. ἦρχον ib. 2.378, etc.; Dor. ἆρχον Pi. O. 10(11).51: fut. ἄρξω Od. 4.667, A. Pr. 940, Th. 1.144: aor. ἦρξα, Ep. ἄρξα Od. 14.230, etc.: pf. ἦρχα CIG 3487.14 ( Thyatira), Decr. ap. Plu. VOrat. 2.851f:— Med., Od. 8.90, etc.; non-thematic part. ἄρχμενος Call. Aet. 3.1.56 [Fr. 75.56 Pf.], al.: impf., Il. 9.93, Hdt. 5.28: fut. ἄρξομαι (in med. sense, v. infr.) Il. 9.97, E. IA 442, X. Cyr. 8.8.2; Dor. ἀρξεῦμαι Theoc. 7.95: aor. ἠρξάμην Od. 23.310, etc.:— Pass., pf. ἦργμαι only in med. sense, v. infr. I.2: aor. ἤρχθην, ἀρχθῆναι Th. 6.18, Arist. Pol. 1277b13, v. infr. II.4:—

children.definition: to be first,

children.label: I
children.definition: begin, make a beginning, Act. and Med. (in Hom. the Act. is more freq., in Att. Prose the Med., esp. where personal action is emphasized), πολέμου ἄρχειν to be the aggressor, Th. 1.53; π. ἄρχεσθαι to begin oneʼs operations, X. HG 6.3.6; ἄρχειν τοῦ λόγου to open a conversation, Id. An. 1.6.6; ἄρχεσθαι τοῦ λόγου to begin oneʼs speech, ib. 3.2.7. Constr.:

make a beginning of, ἄρχειν πολέμοιο Il. 4.335; μύθων Od. 3.68; τῶν ἀδικημάτων πρῶτον τοῦτο ἄρξαι Hdt. 1.2; ἦρξεν ἐμβολῆς A. Pers. 409; τοῦ κακοῦ ib. 353; ἄρχειν χειρῶν ἀδίκων, ἄρχειν τῆς πληγῆς, strike the first blow, Antipho 4.2.1 and 2:— in Med. in religious sense, = ἀπάρχεσθαι, ἀρχόμενος μελέων beginning with the limbs, Od. 14.428, cf. E. Ion 651; but Act., σπονδαῖσιν ἄρξαι Pi. I. 6(5).37.

begin from or with . . , ἐν σοὶ μὲν λήξω σέο δʼ ἄρξομαι Il. 9.97; ἄρχεσθαι Διός Pi. N. 5.25; πόθεν ἄρξωμαι; A. Ch. 855; πόθεν ποτὲ ἦρκται Hp. VM 5; ἄρχεσθαι, ἦρχθαι ἔκ τινος, Od. 23.199, Hp. Off. 11; ἀπό τινος freq. in Prose, ἀρξάμενοι αὐτίκα ἀπὸ παιδίων even from boyhood, Hdt. 3.12; but more commonly ἐκ παίδων, ἐκ παιδός, etc., Pl. R. 408d, Thg. 128d:— ἀπό in non-temporal relations, ἀρξάμενος ἀπὸ σοῦ. i.e. including yourself, Pl. Grg. 471c, cf. D. 18.297; ἀπὸ τῶν πατέρων X. Mem. 3.5.15; μέχρι τῶν δώδεκα ἀπὸ μιᾶς ἀρξάμενος Pl. Lg. 771c; ἀφʼ ἱερῶν ἠργμένη ἀρχή ib. 771a; ἀφʼ Ἑστίας ἀρχόμενος Ar. V. 846.

data.quote: ἐν σοὶ μὲν λήξω σέο δʼ ἄρξομαι
μέχρι τῶν δώδεκα ἀπὸ μιᾶς ἀρξάμενος

children.definition: ἄρχε θεοῖς δαιτός begin a banquet to the gods, Il. 15.95; τοῖς ἄρα μύθων ἦρχε 2.433, etc.; τῇσι δὲ . . ἄρχετο μολπῆς Od. 6.101; ἦρξε τῇ πόλει ἀνομίας τὸ νόσημα Th. 2.53, cf. 12; τὴν ἡμέραν ἄρχειν ἐλευθερίας τῇ Ἑλλάδι X. HG 2.2.23; ἡμὶν οὐ σμικρῶν κακῶν ἦρξεν τὸ δῶρον S. Tr. 871.

data.quote: ἦρξε τῇ πόλει ἀνομίας τὸ νόσημα
τὴν ἡμέραν ἄρχειν ἐλευθερίας τῇ Ἑλλάδι
ἡμὶν οὐ σμικρῶν κακῶν ἦρξεν τὸ δῶρον

children.definition: ἄρχειν ὁδόν τινι, show him the way, Od. 8.107 (but also ἄρχειν ὁδοῖο lead the way, 5.237): abs. (sc. ὁδόν) , ἄρχε δʼ Ἀθήνη 3.12; σὺ μὲν ἄρχε Il. 9.69; ἦ ῥα καὶ ἄρχε λέχοσδε κιών 3.447; ἦρχε δʼ ἄρα σφιν Ἄρης 5.592, cf. infr. II.2: with other accusatives, ἄρχειν ὕμνον Pi. N. 3.10; ἅπερ ἦρξεν A. Ag. 1529 (lyr.); λυπηρόν τι S. El. 552; ὕβριν Id. Fr. 368.

data.quote: ἦ ῥα καὶ ἄρχε λέχοσδε κιών

children.definition: σέο δʼ ἕξεται ὅττι κεν ἄρχῃ Il. 9.102: freq. c. inf., τοῖσιν δʼ ἦρχʼ ἀγορεύειν among them, Il. 1.571, etc.; ἦρχε νέεσθαι, ἦρχʼ ἴμεν, 2.84, 13.329; ἄρχετε νῦν νέκυας φορέειν Od. 22.437, etc.; ὑφαίνειν ἤρχετο μῆτιν Il. 7.324; ἤρξαντο οἰκοδομεῖν Th. 1.107; ἡ νόσος ἤρξατο γενέσθαι Id. 2.47: c. part., of continued action or condition, ἦρχον χαλεπαίνων Il. 2.378; ἢν ἄρξῃ ἀδικέων Hdt. 4.119; ἡ ψυχὴ ἄρχεται ἀπολείπουσα X. Cyr. 8.7.26; πόθεν ἂν ὀρθῶς ἀρξαίμεθα ἐπαινοῦντες; Pl. Mx. 237a, cf. Tht. 187a (but ἄ. ἐπαινεῖν Id. Phdr. 241e); ἄρξομαι διδάσκων X. Cyr. 8.8.2 (but ἤρξω μανθάνειν Id. Mem. 3.5.22).

data.quote: σέο δʼ ἕξεται ὅττι κεν ἄρχῃ

children.definition: ἄρχε take the lead! Il. 9.69: generally, begin, ἄρχειν [τὴν ἐκεχειρίαν] τήνδε τὴν ἡμέραν Indut. ap. Th. 4.118, cf. Lex ap. D. 24.42; τὸ ἄρχον, opp. τὸ ἑπόμενον, Dam. Pr. 234: part. ἀρχόμενος at first, X. Eq. 9.3, Cyn. 3.8, Isoc. 2.54; at the beginning, ἀρχομένου δὲ πίθου καὶ λήγοντος Hes. Op. 368, cf. Fr. 192.4; ἀρχομένοισιν ἢ καταπαυομένοισι Ar. Eq. 1246; ἄρχεται ὁ πόλεμος ἐνθένδε Th. 2.1; ἅμα ἦρι ἀρχομένῳ ibid.; θέρους εὐθὺς ἀρχομένου ib. 47.
ἄ. ἀπὸ φωνήεντος D.T. 633.27; ἡ ἄρχουσα (sc. συλλαβή) A.D. Synt. 130.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: rule, govern, command,
rule, be leader of . . , Βοιωτῶν Il. 2.494, cf. Hdt. 5.1, etc.

ἀνδράσιν ἦρξα Od. 14.230, cf. 471, Il. 2.805, Pi. P. 3.4, A. Pr. 940, E. Andr. 666, IA 337, IG 7.2830 ( Hyettus), etc.; also ἐν δʼ ἄρα τοῖσιν ἦρχʼ held command among them, Il. 13.690, cf. Pl. Phdr. 238a: c. inf. added, ἄρχε Μυρμιδόνεσσι μάχεσθαι led them on to fight, Il. 16.65.

rule, ὅσον τό τʼ ἄρχειν καὶ τὸ δουλεύειν δίχα A. Pr. 927, cf. Pers. 774; esp. hold a magistracy, ὁκοῖόν τε εἴη ἄρχειν μετὰ τὸ βασιλεύειν Hdt. 6.67; at Athens, etc., to be archon, D. 21.178; ἀρχάς, ἀρχὴν ἄρχειν, Hdt. 3.80, Th. 6.54; ἄρχειν τὴν ἐπώνυμον (with or without ἀρχήν) IG 3.659, 693, SIG 872.7.

data.quote: ὅσον τό τʼ ἄρχειν καὶ τὸ δουλεύειν δίχα
ὁκοῖόν τε εἴη ἄρχειν μετὰ τὸ βασιλεύειν

children.definition: Pass., with fut. ἄρξομαι Hdt. 7.159, Pi. O. 8.45, A. Pers. 589, Lys. 28.7; but ἀρχθήσομαι Arist. Pol. 1259b40, D.C. 65.10:— to be ruled, governed, etc., ὑπό τινος Hdt. 1.127; ἔκ τινος S. El. 264, Ant. 63; ὑπό τινι Hdt. 1.91, 103; σφόδρα ὑπό τινος Lys. 12.92; ἄρχε πρῶτον μαθὼν ἄρχεσθαι Sol. ap. D.L. 1.60, cf. Pl. Prt. 326d; δύνασθαι καὶ ἄρχεσθαι καὶ ἄρχειν Arist. Pol. 1277b14; οἱ ἀρχόμενοι subjects, X. An. 2.6.19, etc.

definition: ἄρχων, οντος, ὁ, ( part. of ἄρχω)

children.definition: ruler, commander, νεός Hdt. 5.33: abs., A. Th. 674, S. Aj. 668, etc.; chief, king, Ἀσίας A. Pers. 73; ἄ. τοῦ κόσμου τούτου, of Satan, Ev.Jo. 16.11, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: chief magistrate, esp. at Athens, Th. 1.126, etc.; οἱ ἐννέα ἄρχοντες IG 2.163; οἱ ἄ., at Sparta, the authorities, Hdt. 6.106: sg., ὁ ἄρχων the eponymous magistrate of the year, IG 1.52, al., Arist. Ath. 3.3, etc.; so in Boeotia, at Delphi, Delos, and elsewhere, IG 7.2407, SIG 295.18, IG 2.814, etc.; = Lat. consul, Plb. 1.39.1.
governor of a dependency or province, e.g. in the Athenian Empire, IG 1.62b19, etc.; of a Roman governor, OGI 441.59; = praefectus, Plb. 6.26.5.
magistrate, official, Aeschin. 3.29, etc.; opp. ἰδιώτης, SIG 672.16 (Delph.); ruler of a synagogue, Ev.Matt. 9.18; president of a club, PLond. 3.1178.6 (ii A. D.).
to be an ἀρχώνης, PRev.Laws 14.3, al., BCH 1.410 ( Callipolis).

chief contractor or farmer of revenue, And. 1.133 ( ἄρχων εἷς codd.), PRev.Laws 10.10, al., CIG (add.) 3912; ἀ. λιμένων, = promagister portorii, Ephes. 2 No.29; ἀ. τεσσαρακοστῆς λιμένων Ἀσίας promagister quadragesimae . . , OGI 525.5 (Halic.).
Pl.Com. 233.

aid, succour, Ζηνὸς ἀρωγῇ Il. 4.408; ἐς μέσον . . δικάσσατε μηδʼ ἐπʼ ἀρωγῇ judge impartially and not in any oneʼs favour, ib. 23.574; πέμπειν ἀ. A. Ch. 477 (lyr.); οὐδʼ ἔχων ἀ. S. Ph. 856 (lyr.); in parody of A., Ar. Ra. 1267 sq.; ἀ.νόσου, πόνων, help against . . , Pl. Lg. 919c, Mx. 238a.

children.label: II
children.definition: an aid, succour, διπλᾶς ἀρωγὰς μολεῖν, of Apollo and Artemis, S. OC 1094 (lyr.); στρατιῶτιν ἀ., of the Greek host, A. Ag. 47, cf. 73 (lyr.).—Poet. word, rare in Prose.
helper of sailors, AP 9.290 ( Phil.).
aiding, succouring, propitious, τινί Pi. O. 2.49, A. Eu. 289: abs., Id. Pr. 997, S. OT 206 (lyr.):—rare in Prose, beneficial, medically, Hp. Aër. 10; ἔλαιον . . ταῖς θριξὶ ἀ. Pl. Prt. 334b.

serviceable, useful towards a thing, ἀρωγὰ τῆς δίκης ὁρκώματα A. Eu. 486; γένος ναΐας ἀρωγὸν τέχνας serviceable in sea-craft, S. Aj. 357; δίψους ἀ. against thirst, Antiph. 150; πόνων Luc. Trag. 54: with Preps., ἐπὶ ψευδέσσι Il. 4.235; πρός τι Th. 7.62: and c. dat., ῥίζας ἐχίεσσιν ἀ. serviceable against, Nic. Th. 636.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., helper, esp. in battle, ὅσοι Δαναοῖσιν ἀρωγοί Il. 8.205, etc.; also, defender before a tribunal, advocate, ib. 18.502; ἀρωγοὺς ξυνδίκους θʼ ἥξω λαβών A. Supp. 726.
LXX Le. 11.19, al.
aromatic herb or spice, Hp. Aph. 5.28, X. An. 1.5.1, prob. in Supp.Epigr. 1.414 ( Crete, v/iv B. C., pl.), Arist. Pr. 907a13, IG 5(2).514.17 ( Lycosura, ii B.C., pl.), Plu. Phoc. 20.
arable land, corn-land, S. Fr. 75 (pl.), Ar. Pax 1158, Eup. 304.
spice, στέαρ Dsc. 1.66:— Pass., Id. 2.76.10; ἠρωματισμένον ἔλαιον Inscr.Prien. 112.62 (i B.C.).
have a spicy flavour or scent, D.S. 2.49, Str. 16.2.41, Plu. QConv. 2.623e.
aromatic, δυνάμεις Dsc. 2.171, Plu. Isid. 2.383f; -κόν, τό, ib. An seni 791b; -κή (sc. ὠνή), ἡ, contract for supply of spices, Röm.Mitt. 13.121.
one must spice, perfume, Dsc. 2.76.8.

definition: ἀρωματίτης, ου, ὁ, fem. ἀρωμᾰτ-ῖτις, ιδος, ἡ,

children.definition: Dsc. 5.54; σχοῖνος Str. 16.2.16.
dealer in spices, Ptol. Tetr. 179, Artem. 2.22.
spice-bearing, [ γῆ] Str. 1.2.32; Ἀραβία Dsc. 1.13, cf. Plu. Alex. 25, Luc. Macr. 17.
Subst. -φόρος, ὁ, servant in charge of spices, J. AJ 17.8.3.
like spice, spicy, Dsc. 1.13, Gal. 1.399, Ath. 1.33e.
Phan. ap. Ath. 9.371d.

definition: ἀρωραῖος, hyperdor. for ἀρουραῖος, Ar. Ach. 762.
ἀρώσιμος [ ᾰ], ον, poet. for ἀρόσιμος (q. v.), S. Ant. 569.
ἄρωστος [ ᾰ], ον, poet. for ἄρρωστος, AP 11.206 ( Lucill.).

children.definition: Sapph. 25, Pi. O. 10(11).51, Ar. Lys. 173, Theoc. 14.70; esp. in sense as long as, Leg.Gort. 4.27, al., Tab.Heracl. 1.100.

definition: ἆσαι, contr. for ἀάσαι, v. ἀάω.

children.definition: not trodden down, γῆ X. Oec. 19.11.
not having been at Salamis, Ar. Ra. 204.

definition: ἀσάλγαν ὕβριν, ἀμέλειαν, Hsch. ἀσαλγάνας· φοβερός, Id.; cf. ἀσελγής.

children.definition: carelessness, Sophr. 113.

definition: ἀσάλειν [ σᾰ]· ἀφροντισθῆναι, σάλα γὰρ ἡ φροντίς, Hsch.

children.definition: unmoved, unshaken, ἀ. ἡ γῆ Arist. Mu. 392b34; of Delos, AP 9.100 ( Alph.); ἔσται ἀσάλευτον πρὸ ὀφθαλμῶν LXX Ex. 13.16, al.; πρῷρα Act.Ap. 27.41; of the sea, prob. in Plu. Sollert. 2.982f: metaph. of the mind, E. Ba. 391 (lyr.); ἀ. ἡσυχία Pl. Ax. 370d; πίστις Polystr. p.10 W.; βασιλεία Ep.Hebr. 12.28; στάλα ἀ. Hymn.Is. 4; νίκη IG 9(1).270 ( Atalante); ἀ. μένειν, of ordinances, PLips. 34.35 (iv A.D.), cf. Sammelb. 4324.12. Adv. -τως Plb. 9.9.8: neut. pl. as Adv., χείλεσι ἀσάλευτα μεμυκόσι AP 12.183 ( Strat.).
unthinking, careless, μανία A. Fr. 319; cf. ἀσάλειν.
Plu. Sollert. 2.981c.
without sound of trumpet, ὥρα ἀ. the hour when no trumpet sounds, i.e. midnight, S. Fr. 389.

bathing-tub, ἔς ῥʼ ἀσάμινθον ἕσασα having made sit in it, Od. 10.361; ἔκ ῥʼ ἀ. βῆ 3.468; ἔς ῥʼ ἀσαμίνθους βάντες ἐϋξέστας Il. 10.576, al.; ἀργυρέας ἀ. Od. 4.128: rare in Att., ἐξ ἀ. κύλικος λείβων from a cup as large as a bath, Cratin. 234; later, Artem. 1.56, PStrassb. 29.37 (iii A. D.).

definition: Ἀσάνα, Ἀσᾶναι, Ἀσᾱναῖος, Lacon. for Ἀθην-, Ar. Lys. 1300, 980, al.

children.definition: unsandalled, unshod, Pherecyd. 105J., Bion 1.21.
not to be soothed, ungentle, θυμός A. Ch. 422 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
not decayed, Hp. Epid. 5.27, Arist. Pr. 909b4, Thphr. HP 3.12.3. Adv. -έως, = ἀπέπτως (acc. to Gal. ad loc.), Hp. Acut. 16.
Aët. 1.131, Suid.
made from hazelwort ( ἄσαρον), Dsc. 5.58, Gp. 8.6 tit.
make lean, Hp. Vict. 1.35.
want of flesh, leanness, Arist. HA 493b23, Aret. SD 1.8, 16, Luc. Anach. 25.

without flesh, lean, opp. σαρκώδης, Hp. VM 8, X. Cyn. 4.1, Arist. Pr. 867b34 ( Sup.), Opp. C. 1.474 ( Sup.); φύλλον Thphr. HP 3.11.1 ( Comp.); bare of flesh, Hp. Fract. 18; ὀστᾶ Com.Adesp. 1205; τέττιξ AP 9.264 ( Apollon. or Phil.): Comp., ib. 5.101 (Marc. Arg).
not consisting in flesh, δίαιτα Epicur. Fr. 464; τροφή Porph. Abst. 1.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ- copul.) fleshy, Lyc. 154.
lean, meagre-looking, Aret. SD 1.8.
hazelwort, Asarum europaeum, Crateuas Fr. 7, Dsc. 1.10, Gal. 11.840, Androm. ap. Gal. 14.52.

definition: ἄσαρος, Aeol. for ἀσηρός, Sapph. 77 ( Comp.). ἄσᾰρος, ον, = sq., Hsch.

children.definition: unswept, οἶκος a room paved in mosaic to look as if strewn with crumbs, Plin. HN 36.184.
hurt.
want of clearness, uncertainty, obscurity, opp. σαφήνεια, Pl. R. 478c, cf. Plu. Sol. 19, Arr. Tact. 1.3; personified, Emp. 122.4:—later ἀσᾰφία, ἡ, Plb. 1.67.11; Ion. ἀσᾰφίη Hp. Praec. 14.
not explained, declared, Sch. E. Med. 722 (dub.).

indistinct (to the senses), dim, faint, σημεῖα Th. 3.22; σκιαγραφία Pl. Criti. 107d; indistinct (to the mind), uncertain, obscure, πάντʼ . . αἰνικτὰ κἀσαφῆ λέγεις S. OT 439; νὺξ διὰ τὸ σκοτεινὴ εἶναι ἀσαφεστέρα ἐστίν by night one sees less distinctly, X. Mem. 4.3.4; ἀ. πέλαγος AP 12.156; inarticulate, γλῶσσα Hp. Epid. 1.4.13 [1.26.ιγʹ]; of sounds, Arist. Aud. 801b21; φθέγματα Epigr.Gr. 1003.6.
obscure, διδάσκαλος Pl. R. 392d.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -φῶς obscurely, Id. Cra. 427d; πολεμοῦνται ἀσαφῶς ποτέρων ἀρξάντων without knowing which began, Th. 4.20.

definition: ἀσάω [ᾰσ-], Thgn. 593; elsewh. Pass. ἀσάομαι, imper. ἀσῶ, part. ἀσώμενος: aor. ἠσήθην : ( ἄση):—orig.

children.definition: glut oneself, take a surfeit, and so perh. in Sapph. Supp. 2.7; but usu., feel loathing or nausea, caused by surfeit, ἀσᾶται Hp. Morb.Sacr. 25, Int. 35; of pregnant women, Arist. HA 584a22: metaph., to be disgusted or vexed at a thing, c.dat., μηδὲν ἄγαν χαλεποῖσιν ἀσῶ φρένα Thgn. 657, cf. 593; ὅταν δέ τι θυμὸν ἀσηθῇς Id. 989; ἄσαιο Sapph. l.c.; ἐδίζητο ἐπʼ ᾧ ἂν μάλιστα τὴν ψυχὴν ἀσηθείη Hdt. 3.41; ἀσώμενος ἐν φρεσί Theoc. 25.240; Aeol. ἀσάμενοι [σᾱ] disgusted, Alc. 35.—Never in good Att.; in later Prose, πολλὰ ἀσώμενοι καὶ ἀδημονοῦντες Ph. Fr. 74 H.

data.quote: ἐδίζητο ἐπʼ ᾧ ἂν μάλιστα τὴν ψυχὴν ἀσηθείη

children.definition: plasterers, Hsch. s.v. κονιαταί.
non-combustible material, dub. l. in Plin. HN 19.20.

definition: ἄσβεστος, ον, also η, ον Il. 16.123:—

children.definition: unquenchable, inextinguishable, φλόξ Il. l.c.; not quenched, πῦρ ἄ. D.H. 3.67, Plu. Num. 9; κλέος Od. 4.584; γέλως Il. 1.599; βοή 11.50; ἐργμάτων ἀκτὶς καλῶν ἄ. αἰεί Pi. I. 4(3).42; ἄ. πόρος ὠκεανοῦ oceanʼs ceaseless flow, A. Pr. 532 (lyr.); πῦρ, of hell, Ev.Marc. 9.43.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., ἄσβεστος (sc. τίτανος), ἡ, unslaked lime, Dsc. 5.115, Plu. Sert. 17, Eum. 16; ἄ. κονία Lyc. ap. Orib. 8.25.16.
Plin. HN 37.146.
plastering, Hsch. s.v. κονίασις.
fuscatur, Gloss.
turning into soot, Eust. 1949.36.

definition: ἄσβολος, ἡ ( ὁ, Hippon. 105), more Att. form for ἀσβόλη,

children.definition: soot, Ar. Th. 245, Alex. 98.16, Thphr. Ign. 39, Luc. Tim. 2.
cover with soot, in pf. part. Pass. ἠσβολωμένος Macho ap. Ath. 13.581e, cf. Plu. Cim. 1, Arr. Epict. 3.16.3.
sooty, Dsc. 1.68.6.

definition: Ἀσγελάτας, epith. of Apollo, IG 12(3).248.8, 27 ( Anaphe); cf. Αἰγλάτας:—hence Ἀσγελαῖα, τά, festival of Apollo, ib. 249.22.
ἆσε, contr. for ἄασε, v. ἀάω.

children.definition: ungodliness, impiety, opp. ἀδικία, διὰ τὴν ἐκείνων περὶ μὲν θεοὺς ἀ. περὶ δὲ ἀνθρώπους ἀδικίαν X. Cyr. 8.8.7; ἀ. εἰς τοὺς θεούς Antipho 5.88, cf. Pl. R. 615c, etc.; also ἀ. ἀπὸ τοῦ θεοῦ LXX 2 Ki. 22.22; ἀ. ἀσκεῖν E. Ba. 476; δίκη ἀσεβείας πρὸς τὸν βασιλέα Lys. 6.11; ἀσεβείας γράφεσθαί τινα Pl. Euthphr. 5c: at Rome, disloyalty to the Emperor (as θεός), D.C. 57.9; of Christianity, Id. 68.1: in pl., ἀσέβειαι ἀνθρώποις ἐμπίπτουσι νέοις Pl. Lg. 890a.

data.quote: ἀδικία, διὰ τὴν ἐκείνων περὶ μὲν θεοὺς ἀ. περὶ δὲ ἀνθρώπους ἀδικίαν

children.definition: to be impious, act profanely, commit sacrilege, Hdt. 1.159; opp. ἀδικέω, Ar. Th. 367; ἀ. ἐς τὸν νηόν Hdt. 8.129, cf. E. Ba. 490, Antipho 5.93; περὶ τὰ ἱρά, τοὺς θεούς, Hdt. 2.139, Antipho 4.1.2, cf. X. Ap. 22, etc.; πρὸς τὰ θεῖα Id. Cyn. 13.16: c. acc. cogn., ἀ. ἀσέβημα Pl. Lg. 910e; ἀγγελίας καὶ ἐπιτάξεις παρὰ νόμον ἀ. ib. 941a; περὶ οὗ τὴν ἑορτὴν ἀσεβῶν ἕαλωκε D. 21.227.

data.quote: περὶ οὗ τὴν ἑορτὴν ἀσεβῶν ἕαλωκε

children.definition: sin against, ἢ θεὸν ἢ ξένον τινʼ ἀσεβῶν A. Eu. 271 (lyr.); ἀ. θεούς D.S. 1.77, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.291c; τὸ ἱαρὸν IG 7.2418 ( Thebes, iv B. C.); τὸν Καίσαρα POxy. 1612.23 (iii A. D.):— Pass., ἀσεβοῦνται οἱ θεοί Lys. 2.7; ἠσεβῆσθαι πρός τινος D.C. 57.9; of households, to be affected with the consequences of sin, ὅταν τις ἀσεβηθῇ τῶν οἴκων Pl. Lg. 877e.

data.quote: ἢ θεὸν ἢ ξένον τινʼ ἀσεβῶν

children.definition: Pass. also of the act, ἐμοὶ ἠσέβηται οὐδὲν περί τινος And. 1.10; τὰ ἠσεβημένα Lys. 6.6.
impious or profane act, sacrilege, opp. ἀδίκημα, Antipho 2.1.3, Th. 6.27, D. 21.104; τὰ περὶ τοὺς θεοὺς ἀσεβήματα Id. 16.130.

ungodly, unholy, profane, sacrilegious, opp. εὐσεβής, Pi. Fr. 132.1, A. Supp. 9 (anap.); τὸν ἀσεβῆ, of Oedipus, S. OT 1382, 1441; σκοπῶν τί ἀ. X. Mem. 1.1.16: c. gen., θεῶν ἀσεβής against them, Paus. 4.8.1; ἀσεβέστεροι περὶ θεούς X. Cyr. 8.8.27; πρὸς ἀλλοτρίους J. BJ 5.10.5. Adv. -βῶς, Sup. -έστατα D.C. 79.9.
without trace, ἵππος Eust. 1734.2.
not drawn by a trace (but by the yoke, cf. σειραφόρος) , ὄχημα E. Ion 1150.
unshaken, γῆ Max.Tyr. 41.4: metaph., εὐδαιμονία Id. 4.5 [33.5.a], cf. D.L. 8.26. Adv. -τως unshakably, Epicur. Ep. 2p.36U., Arr. Epict. 2.17.33.

definition: ἄσεκτος, ον, Dor. for ἄψεκτος, Rhinth. 15.
ἀσελγαίνω, impf. ἠσέλγαινον D. 21.31: fut. ἀσελγᾰνῶ Id. 24.143: aor. inf. ἀσελγᾶναι D.C. 52.31:— Pass., pf. ἠσέλγημαι (v. infr.): plpf. ἠσέλγητο J. AJ 17.5.6:—

children.definition: to be ἀσελγής, behave licentiously, And. 4.7, Pl. Smp. 190c; εἴς τινα D. 54.5:— Pass., of acts, τὰ εἰς ἐμὲ ἠσελγημένα outrageous acts, Id. 21.19.

licentiousness, wanton violence, Pl. R. 424e, Is. 3.13, etc., οἷ προελήλυθʼ ἀσελγείας ἅνθρωπος D. 4.9: joined with ὕβρις, Id. 21.1; insolence, opp. κολακεία, Phld. Lib. p.42 O.; τῶν δημαγωγῶν Arist. Pol. 1304b22: Astrol., epith. of certain ζῴδια, Vett.Val. 335.34.

children.label: II
children.definition: licentiousness, περὶ τὰς σωματικὰς ἐπιθυμίας Plb. 36.15.4, etc.

definition: ἀσελγέω, late form of ἀσελγαίνω, Sch. Ar. Pl. 1093.

children.definition: licentious act, prob. in Plb. 38.2.2, cf. Plu. in Hes. 64 [fr. 85 Sandbach], Suid. s.v. ἀστυάνασσα; vulgar abuse, in pl., POxy. 903.21 (iv A. D.).

licentious, wanton, brutal, And. 4.40 ( Sup.), D. 2.19 ( Comp.); εἰς ἔμʼ ἀ. καὶ βίαιος Id. 21.128, cf. Is. 8.43; σκῶμμα Eup. 244: generally, outrageous, ἄνεμος Id. 320. Adv. -γῶς, πίονες extravagantly fat, Ar. Pl. 560; ἀ. ζῆν D. 36.45; ἀ. διακείμενος Lys. 24.15; ἀ. τινὶ χρῆσθαι D. 9.35.

children.label: II
children.definition: lascivious, lewd, Jul. Caes. 315c.
with outrageous horn, κριός Pl.Com. 210.
to be madly dissolute, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 7.
producing licentious persons, δεκανοί Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8 (3).109.13.
moonless, νύξ Th. 3.22, cf. Plb. 7.16.3, App. BC 5.114.
without crown of celery, νίκη D.C. 68.19.
not solemnly extolled, Eust. 342.39.

undignified, ignoble, Arist. Mu. 398b4, Ph. 2.406, Hdn. 2.7.1; esp. in Lit. Crit., D.H. Comp. 7, al., Demetr. Eloc. 189, Longin. 43.1; indecent, Eust. 1950.63. Adv. -νως A.D. Conj. 232.9, al.; βίον ἀ. διῆγεν BGU 1024 vii 22 (iv/v A.D.).
S. Ant. 1350 (lyr.).
unholy, τὰ ἄσεπτα S. OT 890 (lyr.); Πρωτέως ἀσέπτου παιδός E. Hel. 542, cf. Pae.Delph. 22.
surfeit, loathing, nausea, Hp. Aph. 5.61 (pl.), Acut. (Sp.) 14; ἄση περὶ τὴν καρδίαν Epid. 7.10; ἄ. πλησμονή Sch. Il. Oxy. 221 xi 18.

distress, vexation, Hdt. 1.136, Andronic.Rhod. p.570 M.; ἔπαυσε καρδίαν ἄσης E. Med. 245: pl., μή μʼ ἄσαισι μήτʼ ὀνίαισι δάμνα θῦμον Sapph. 1.3, cf. Alc. Supp. 14.11; λύπας καὶ ἄσας παρέχειν Pl. Ti. 71c, cf. Stoic. 3.100.

data.quote: μή μʼ ἄσαισι μήτʼ ὀνίαισι δάμνα θῦμον

children.definition: longing, desire, κῆρ ἄσᾳ βόρηται Sapph. 96.17 L.-P..

children.label: II
children.definition: Luc. Cyn. 1, Poll. 1.49, Opp. H. 3.433. (Cf. ἄω satiate.)

definition: ἀσηκορίς ἀδικία, Hsch. ἀσήκορος· ἀκηδιαστής, Id.

children.definition: ‘electron-man’, Zos.Alch. p.207B.; cf. ἀργυράνθρωπος.
without leader or shepherd, μήλοισιν ἀσημάντοισιν ἐπελθών Il. 10.485, cf. Tryph. 616; δόμος Opp. H. 3.361.

children.label: II
children.definition: unsealed, unmarked, Hdt. 2.38, Pl. Lg. 954a, Hyp. Fr. 4; = ἀφύλακτος, Hsch.
giving no sign: hence, unseen, unknown, Nonn. D. 3.95, 5.232; unintelligible, ἔπεα ib. 10.31.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀσήμαντοι τούτου ὃ . . σῶμα ὀνομάζομεν not entombed in this, which we call body, Pl. Phdr. 250c, with play on signf. II.1, cf. Dam. Pr. 161.

children.label: IV
children.definition: uncoined, χρυσὸς καὶ ἄργυρος App. Hisp. 23, Pun. 66.

children.label: V
children.definition: Act., opp. σημαντικός, without significance, λέξις Diog.Bab.Stoic. 3.213; φωνή Plu. An.procr. 2.1026a. Adv. -τως Paul.Aeg. 3.15.
without seal, PMasp. 151.10 (vi A. D.).
unnoticed, πηγὴν παρελθεῖν Ph. 1.121; ἀσαμήωτον αὐτοῦ τὰν παρουσίαν ἀφέμεν GDI 3059.22 ( Byzantium, i A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: without signposts, of a road, Demetr. Eloc. 202.

children.label: III
children.definition: not capable of being inferred by signs, ἀσημείωτα πάντα ποιοῦσι τἀφανῆ Phld. Sign. 30.
thief of plate, AP 11.360.

without mark or token, ἄ. χρυσός uncoined gold, bullion, or plate, Hdt. 9.41; ἄ. χρυσίον, ἀργύριον, Th. 2.13, 6.8, Alex. 69; freq. in Inscrr., opp. ἐπίσημον, IG 1.170.6, 2.652 B22, etc., cf. Luc. Cont. 10; also of cattle, not branded, IG 7.3171; of persons, without distinguishing marks (e. g. οὐλαί), PGrenf. 1.27.7, al.; ἄ. ὅπλα arms without device, E. Ph. 1112: generally, shapeless, formless, Opp. C. 3.160.

τὸ ἄσημον (sc. ἀργύριον) plate, silver, LXX Jb. 42.11, AP 11.371 ( Pall.); μέταλλα ἀσήμου silver-mines, Ptol. Geog. 7.2.17: also, = electron, alloy of gold and silver, or an imitation thereof, Ps.-Democr.Alch. p.49 B., etc.:—masc. ἄσημος, ὁ, PLeid.X. 6, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: unintelligible, χρηστήρια Hdt. 5.92.βʹ; ; χρησμοί A. Pr. 662; ἄ. ὀργίων μαντεύματε S. Ant. 1013.

children.label: III
children.definition: leaving no mark, indistinct,

children.label: a
children.definition: πτερῶν γὰρ ῥοῖβδος οὐκ ἄ. ἦν ib. 1004; of sounds and voices, inarticulate, unintelligible, ἄσημα φράζειν Hdt. 1.86; ἄ. κνυζήματα Id. 2.2; ἄσημα βοῆς, = ἄσημος βοή, S. Ant. 1209.

children.label: b
children.definition: without significance, meaningless, [ τοῦ διπλοῦ ὀνόματος] τὸ μὲν ἐκ σημαίνοντος καὶ ἀσήμου Arist. Po. 1457a33, Rh. 1405a35; ἄσημα τρίζειν, of a mouse, Babr. 108.23; μόριον Stoic. 2.46; λέξις Simp. in Ph. 1164.4.

data.quote: τοῦ διπλοῦ ὀνόματος] τὸ μὲν ἐκ σημαίνοντος καὶ ἀσήμου

children.label: c
children.definition: ἄσημον ἔχειν μυελόν Arist. PA 652a1: generally, πρὸς τὴν αἴσθησιν -ότερα Id. Aud. 802a14.

children.label: d
children.definition: unperceived, unnoticed, A. Ag. 1596, S. Ant. 252; ἀσήμων ὑπὲρ ἑρμάτων hidden, sunken rocks, Anacr. 38.

children.label: IV
children.definition: of no mark, obscure, insignificant, οὐκ ἄ. E. HF 849, cf. Ion 8; νὺξ οὐκ ἄ. a night to be remembered (being a feast), Antipho 2.4.8; τὸ τῆς πατρίδος ἢ τοῦ γένους ἄσημον Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.16.

data.quote: τὸ τῆς πατρίδος ἢ τοῦ γένους ἄσημον

children.label: V
children.definition: Adv. -μως without leaving traces, Hp. Epid. 1.1, Morb.Sacr. 11; ἀ. πορεύεσθαι X. Cyn. 3.4; ἀ. καὶ κενῶς φθέγγεσθαι inarticulately, Theopomp.Hist. 250.
ignobly, οὐκ ἀ. D.S. 5.52, Hdn. 1.10.4.
ignobilitas, Gloss.
farming of trade in silver bullion, BGU 1242 (iii/ii B.C.).
not liable to decay or corruption, Hp. Fist. 4, X. Cyn. 9.13 ( Sup.), Arist. HA 521a1, etc.; ξύλα ἄ., of Acacia tortilis, LXX Ex. 25.5, cf. Thphr. HP 4.2.8: Sup., κέδρος Ph. 2.147.
undigested, σιτία Hp. Aff. 24.
causing discomfort, Gal. 18(2).850.
causing discomfort, Hp. Fract. 22, 33, Plu. QConv. 2.713a. Adv. -ρῶς Poll. 3.99.
feeling disgust, disdainful, Sapph. 77 ( Comp.): Medic., feeling discomfort, Ruf. ap. Orib. 45.30.22.
without worms, Suid.
unsifted, Diph Siph. ap. Ath. 3.115d, Sor. 1.50.
want of strength, weakness, Th. 1.3, etc.: in pl., ἰσχύες καὶ ἀ. Pl. R. 618d; esp. feebleness, sickliness, Hdt. 4.135; ἀ. τοῦ γήρως Antipho 4.3.2, Pl. R. 330e; σωμάτων Th. 4.36, etc.
disease, sickness, Id. 2.49 (pl.), OGI 244.11 ( Daphne, ii B.C.), etc.; διʼ ἀσθένειαν Ep.Gal. 4.13.
ἀ. βίου poverty, Hdt. 2.47, 8.51.
feebleness, weakness, τῆς ἀνθρωπίνης φύσεως Pl. Lg. 854a, cf. Arist. EN 1150b19; τοῦ ἀκροατοῦ Arist. Rh. 1419a18.—Rare in poetry, as E. HF 269.

senses.definition: to be weak, feeble, sickly, ἀ. μέλη to be weak in limb, E. Or. 228; τοὺς ὀφθαλμοὺς ἀ. Pl. Ly. 209e; ἀ. ἀσθένειαν Id. Chrm. 155b: abs., E. Hipp. 274, Th. 7.47, Ev.Matt. 10.8, etc.; ἠσθένησε he fell sick, D. 1.13; ἀσθενέων sick man, Hp. VM 12 ( Phot. says that μαλακίζεσθαι is used of women); ἠσθενηκότα Plb. 31.13.7.

children.definition: to be needy, Ar. Pax 636; ἠσθενηκότες, of those unable to pay taxes, PTeb. 188 (i B.C.).
inf., to be too weak to do a thing, not to be able . . , J. BJ 2.15.5; εἰς τὸ θεωρεῖν Plot. 3.8.4.
decline, ἠσθένησεν ἡ ἡμέρα εἰς τὴν ἑσπέραν LXX Jd. 19.9.

data.quote: ἠσθένησεν ἡ ἡμέρα εἰς τὴν ἑσπέραν

children.definition: weakness, ailment, Arist. GA 726a15, Gp. 1.12.27 (pl.); weakness of conscience, Ep.Rom. 15.1 (pl.).
without strength, weak,

feeble, sickly, τοὺς ἀσθενέας τῆς στρατιῆς Hdt. 4.135, cf. Hp. VM 12; ἀσθενεῖ χρωτὶ βαίνων Pi. P. 1.55, etc.; ὁ παντάπασιν ἀ. τῷ σώματι D. 21.165; ἀ. περὶ τὸν ὀφθαλμόν Luc. Nigr. 4; τοὺς ἀσθενεστάτους ἐς τὰς ταλαιπωρίας least able to bear hardship, Hdt. 4.134; ἀσθενέστερος πόνον ἐνεγκεῖν too weak to . . , D. 23.54. Adv. ἀσθενῶς, ἴσχειν Pl. Lg. 659e, cf. OGI 751.8 ( Amblada, ii B.C.).
τὸ ἀ. τῆς γνώμης the weakness, Th. 2.61.
weak, feeble, ἀ. δύναμις Hdt. 7.9.αʹ, cf. 1.58; τέχνη δʼ ἀνάγκης -εστέρα μακρῷ A. Pr. 514; πόλιν ἑνὸς -εστέραν S. OC 1033; εἰς ὠφέλειαν ἀ. D. Ep. 2.15.
weak, poor, οἱ χρήμασιν ἀσθενέστεροι Hdt. 2.88: abs., ὅ τʼ ἀ. ὁ πλούσιός τε E. Supp. 433; οἱ ἀσθενέστεροι the weaker sort, i.e. the poor, X. Cyr. 8.1.30, cf. Lys. 1.2.

data.quote: ὅ τʼ ἀ. ὁ πλούσιός τε

children.definition: insignificant, οὐκ ἀσθενέστατος σοφιστὴς Ἑλλήνων Hdt. 4.95; paltry, ἀ. σόφισμα A. Pr. 1011; of streams, petty, small, Hdt. 2.25; of fluids, of small specific gravity, Id. 3.23; ἐς ἀσθενὲς ἔρχεται comes to nothing, Id. 1.120. Adv. -νῶς feebly, without energy, Pl. R. 528b; on slight evidence, ἀπαγγέλλεσθαι Onos. Praef.: Comp. ἀσθενεστέρως, ἐπιθυμεῖν Pl. Phdr. 255e; -έστερον Id. Chrm. 172b; -έστερα Th. 1.141.
weakly, παιδίον Arist. HA 587a20, Timo 26.1, Luc. Tox. 19. Adv. -κῶς, αἰσθάνεσθαι Arist. Insomn. 462a20.
make weak, App. Mac. 9.6.
causing weakness, Archig. ap. Aët. 12.1, Sch. A.R. 2.205, Sch. Nic. Th. 158.
with weak roots, Thphr. CP 4.14.4.

definition: ἀσθενόφθαλμον ζῴδιον, of the Ram, Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.194.2, cf. 1.166.19.

children.definition: weak-minded, LXX 4 Ma. 15.5.
weaken, X. Cyr. 1.5.3.
weakness, faintness, Hp. Judic. 20.

short-drawn breath, panting, ἄσθμα καὶ ἱδρώς Il. 15.241; ἀργαλέῳ ἄσθματι ib. 10; ὑπʼ ἄσθματος κενοί A. Pers. 484; ἄσθματι στρευγόμενος Tim. Pers. 93; ὑπὸ ἄσθματος ἀδυνατεῖν Pl. R. 568d, cf. 556d; as symptom of anger, Phld. Ir. p.27 W.; death-rattle, Pi. N. 10.74.

children.label: II
children.definition: asthma, Hp. Aph. 3.22 (pl.), etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: breath, breathing, Mosch. 3.53, Luc. DDeor. 19[11].2, Philum. Ven. 36.3; blast, ἀρκτῴοις ἄσθμασι AP 9.677 ( Agath.); ἄ. φλογός Coluth. 179; κεραυνοῦ Nonn. D. 1.2. (On the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 1.522.) [ἆσθμα DGE, ἄσθμα LSJ - HD]

breathe hard: used by Hom. in pres. part., panting, as after running, τὼ δʼ ἀσθμαίνοντε κιχήτην Il. 10.376; gasping for breath, of one dying, ὅ γʼ ἀσθμαίνων . . ἔκπεσε δίφρου 5.585, cf. 10.496, Pi. N. 3.48: pres. ind., Hp. Morb. 3.7, Arist. Pr. 905b33: impf., Luc. DMeretr. 5.4; οὐδὲν ἀσθμαίνων without an effort, A. Eu. 651; ἀ. τι pant for a thing, Hld. 4.3: c. acc. cogn., ἀ. πυρὸς δριμεῖαν ὁμοκλήν Opp. H. 4.14.
suffering from dyspnoea or asthma, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.8.9, Antyll. ib. 6.8.4, Dsc. 1.25, Gal. 13.106; panting, Man. 4.274.
Gloss.

Asia, Pi. O. 7.18, Hdt. 1.4, 4.45, A. Pr. 412; γῆ Ἀσία S. OC 694, etc.:— Adj. Ἀσιᾱνός, ή, όν, Asian, Asiatic, Th. 1.6, etc.; Ἀ. ῥήτορες Theon Prog. 2; Ἀ. ζῆλος Str. 14.1.41, Plu. Ant. 2. Adv. -νῶς, ἑστιᾶν τινά D.C. 46.30:—fem. Ἀσιάς, άδος, and Ἀσίς, ίδος [the latter with ᾱ], freq. in A. and E., never in S., Ἀσιάς being required by the metre in E. Or. 1397 (lyr.), Ba. 1168 (lyr.), Cyc. 443, Ἀσίς in A. Pers. 270 (lyr.), Supp. 547 (lyr.), cf. Euph. 34: Ἀσιάς (sc. γῆ), = Ἀσία, E. Tr. 748, Ion 1356; also (sc. κιθάρα), the Asian harp, Ar. Th. 120, cf. E. Cyc. 443, Plu. Mus. 2.1133c:—also Ἀσιάτης, Ἀσιᾶτις, Ion. Ἀσιήτης, Ἀσιῆτις, A. Pers. 61 (lyr.), E. Andr. 1, etc.: Ἀσιᾱτικός, ή, όν, Str. 15.2.8: Ἀσίηθεν, Adv. from Asia, CIG 6336. (Fem. of ἄσιος (q. v.).)
of Asiatic descent, D.S. 17.77; = Asiaticus, cognomen of Scipio, Id. 35.33: Ion. Ἀσιηγενής, Opp. C. 1.235.

an Asiarch, priest of the Imperial cult in the province of Asia, Str. 14.1.42, Act.Ap. 19.31, IG 12(3).531, 14.2405, etc.; Ἀ. ναῶν τῶν ἐν Ἐφέσῳ OGI 525.8 (Halic.):—hence Ἀσι-αρχέω, BMus.Inscr. 481*.240 ( Ephesus, ii A. D.), etc.
office of Ἀσιάρχης, Dig. 27.1.6.14.
CIG 2990a ( Ephesus).
of Asian birth, A. Pers. 12, Critias 6.6D.
inability to keep silence, Plu. Garr. 2.502c.
never silent, Call. Del. 286, Nonn. D. 42.405, al.
without sigma, ᾠδαί D.H. Comp. 14; ἄ. ᾠδή, name of a poem of Lasus without a sigma in it, Ath. 10.455c:—hence ἀσιγμοποιέω, compose such a poem, ibid.
= Hebr. ḥasidhah, stork, LXX Jb. 39.13, Je. 8.7: cf. ἄσιδον· ἐρωδιόν, Hsch.
not of iron, μοχλοί E. Ba. 1104; not made by iron, αὖλαξ AP 9.299 ( Phil.).

children.label: II
children.definition: without sword, χείρ E. Ba. 736; μάχη sham fight, Onos. 10.4; βίος Max.Tyr. 36.1.
not nice as to food, Plu. Lyc. 16.

children.label: II
children.definition: not easily causing satiety or disgust, of food, Id. Sanit. 2.132b ( Sup.).
yoke, like that of a milk-man, to carry baskets, pails, etc., Simon. 163; ἄ. ἐπωμίους ἀνελόμενοι Alciphr. 1.1 (prob.).
carry a yoke, Democr. 132, prob. in EM 160.34.
carrying a yoke, PLond. 1.44.33 (ii B.C.).

unhurt, unharmed, τὰς εἰ μέν κʼ ἀσινέας ἐάᾳς Od. 11.110; ἀσινέα τινὰ ἀποπέμπειν Hdt. 2.181; ἀ. ἀπικέσθαι, ἀναχωρέειν, Id. 8.19, 116; ἀ. δαίμων secure, happy fortune, A. Ag. 1341; βίοτος Id. Ch. 1018; ἀσινὴς αἰῶνα διοιχνεῖ Id. Eu. 315.

data.quote: τὰς εἰ μέν κʼ ἀσινέας ἐάᾳς

children.definition: undamaged, οἴκημα Hdt. 2.121.γʹ; ἐᾶν τὰ ἐπιθέματα . . ἀσινῆ IG 3.1418, 1419; ὑγιὴς καὶ ἀ. POxy. 278.18 (i A. D.); of ships, App. BC 5.98: metaph., κανόνες ἀληθείας Ph. 1.215.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., doing no harm, Sapph. 80, Hdt. 1.105, Hp. Fract. 28, Schwyzer 197.46 ( Crete, iii B. C.); ἀσινέστεραι πηρώσιες Hp. Art. 61; harmless, of wild asses, X. Cyr. 1.4.7; innocent, ἡδοναί Pl. Lg. 670d; ἀσινέσταται τῶν ἡδονῶν Id. Hp.Ma. 303e.
protecting from harm, πόλεως ἀσινεῖ σωτῆρι A. Th. 826.
Adv. -νῶς, Ion. -νέως Hp. Epid. 1.1, Arist. HA 617a3: Sup. -έστατα X. An. 3.3.3.
innocence, Eun. VS 480B.
mud-walls, Sch. Il. 21.231.

definition: ἄσιος, α, ον, epith. of λειμών, Il. 2.461,

children.definition: Asian, but also expld. as ἰλυώδης, Eust.adloc., or meadow of Asias (reading Ἀσίω), Str. 14.1.45, St.Byz. 131.7.
locust without wings, = τρωξαλλίς, Dsc. 2.52 codd.: ἀσείρακος, Gal. 12.366.
slime, mud, Il. 21.321, Nic. Th. 176; ἐκ θαλάσσης Charito 2.2; cf. ἄσις· κόνις, ἢ εἶδος ὀρνέου, Hsch.
singing, song, Ptol. ap. Eust. 1312.41.

definition: Ἀσίς [ ᾱ], ίδος, ἡ, v. Ἀσία.

children.definition: abstain from food, fast, E. Hipp. 277, Pl. Smp. 220a; ἀ. ἡμέρας δύο Arist. HA 594b20.
have no appetite, Hp. Aph. 2.32.
want of food, Hdt. 3.52, E. Supp. 1105 (both pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: abstinence from food, Hp. Acut. 34, Arist. EN 1180b9.
want of appetite, Hp. Aph. 7.6.
without food, fasting, Od. 4.788, S. Aj. 324, E. Med. 24, Th. 7.40, Phryn.Com. 3 D., etc.; ἰχθύς Pl.Com. 29. Adv. -ως Mantiss.Prov. 1.47: ἀσιτί LXX Jb. 24.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: of forbidden food, εὐωχία ἄ. Ph. 2.398 (dub.l.).
not to be left unspoken, τὸ ἀληθὲς ἀ. Eun. Hist. p.261 D.
ἀ- euph.), Q.S. 5.495 (dub.).

definition: ἀσκάλαβος [ κᾰ], ὁ, = sq., GDI 3123 (Corinthian vase), Nic. Th. 484, Ant.Lib. 24.3.

children.definition: spotted lizard, gecko, Platydactylus mauretanicus, Ar. Nu. 170, Arist. HA 538a27, 607a27; cf. σκαλαβώτης, καλαβώτης.
owl, Arist. HA 509a21.
unhoed, Sch. Theoc. 10.14. ἀσκαλεῶς· ἄγαν σκληρῶς, ἐπιμόνως, Hsch. (i. e. ἀσκελέως).
equilateral, Democr. 132 (prob. ἀσκαληνές, cf. σκαληνός).

definition: ἀσκάληρον, τό, v.l. (ap. Ath.) for σκαλίας (q.v.), Thphr. HP 6.4.11: —also ἀσκαλία, Plin. HN 21.97.

children.definition: hoe, Phryn. PS p.42 B.
Theoc. 10.14.
Theoc. 10.14:—also ἄσκαλτος, ον, Hsch.
Syrian onion, Allium Cepa, Diocl. Fr. 120, Thphr. HP 7.4.7, Plin. HN 19.101. (Hence Eng. shallot, which however is applied to κρόμυον σχιστόν; v. κρόμυον.)
woodcock, Scolopax ruricola, Arist. HA 617b23.
Gp. 12.19.18, Hippiatr. 31, Suid.
ἀπρόσπταιστος, Hsch.
ἄγγελος, Hsch.; cf. Mandaic ashganda ‘messenger’. ἀσκάνη· ἀγανάκτησις, Id.
pallet, Ar. Nu. 633, Luc. Lex. 6.

children.label: II
children.definition: bier, AP 7.634 ( Antiphil.).
look without winking, Sch. Ar. Eq. 292.
one who does not blink, Hp. Epid. 2.6.1 (pl.).
without winking, with unchanged look, X. Cyr. 1.4.28, Luc. Tim. 14, Gal. 7.91, Poll. 2.67, v.l. in Ar. Eq. 292.
not blinking or winking, Ar. Eq. 292, Adam. 1.21. Adv. -τως Eust. 756.59, v.l. in Ar. l.c.
not hopping or skipping, Hsch.:—also ἄσκαρθμος, ον, Id.
full of ascarides, Hp. Coac. 160.

definition: ἀσκαρίζω, fut. -ιῶ, Att. form of σκαρίζω (with ἀ- euph.), Hp. Nat.Puer. 30, Cratin. 26.

children.definition: worm in the intestines, Hp. Aph. 3.26, Arist. HA 551a10.

children.label: II
children.definition: larva of the ἐμπίς, ib. 551b27.
without struggling, Sch. S. Aj. 833.
castanet, Poll. 4.60, Hsch.; also a kind of shoe, Id.
bagpiper, Mart. 10.3, Gloss.
not dug about, ἄμπελοι Str. 11.4.3.
not scattered, τὸ ἓν ἀ. Eustr. in EN 51.13; that cannot be dissipated, Procl. Inst. 48.
Hsch.
dried up, withered, worn out, ἀσκελέες καὶ ἄθυμοι Od. 10.463.
ἀσκελές as Adv., toughly, stubbornly, ἀ. αἰεί ib. 1.68, 4.543; ἀ. αὔτως Nic. Th. 278:—also ἀσκελέως αἰεί Il. 19.68.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ- priv., σκέλος) without legs, Pl. Ti. 34a, Arist. GA 717b17.
ἀ- copul., σκέλος) = ἰσοσκελής, even, of a balance, Nic. Th. 42.

definition: ἀσκελοποιός, όν, ( ἀ- priv., σκέλλω, ποιέω)

children.definition: not allowing to pine, etym. of Ἀσκληπιός, Tz.ad Lyc. 1054.
without the axe, unhewn, βάθρον S. OC 101.
uncovered, Dsc. 5.114, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.23.10, Gp. 7.19.3, PLond. 5.1722 (vi A. D.).
= foreg., Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 7.17, AP 5.259 ( Paul.Sil.), Nonn. D. 46.279, al.; γυμνὸς καὶ ἀ. Max.Tyr. 2.4.
not covering, ἀ. νεφέων γυμνούμενος ἀήρ Nonn. D. 22.214:—also ἄσκεπος, ον, defenceless, Amynt. Epigr. in POxy. 662.37; bare-headed, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 21.

inconsiderate, unreflecting, οὐκ ἄσκεπτα λέγειν Ephipp. 14.5, cf. Pl. R. 438a, Plu. Aud. 2.45d: mostly in Adv. -τως inadvisedly, Th. 6.21, Pl. Chrm. 158e, etc.; ἀ. ἔχειν Id. Cra. 440d; ἀ. ἔχειν τινός Id. Grg. 501c: Comp. -ότερον Arist. Pol. 1274a30, Plu. Demetr. 1.

children.label: II
children.definition: unconsidered, unobserved, Ar. Ec. 258, X. Mem. 4.2.19; μὴ τὸ μέγιστον ἐπιστήμης πέρι τί ποτʼ ἐστὶν ἄσκεπτον γένηται Pl. Tht. 184a.

data.quote: μὴ τὸ μέγιστον ἐπιστήμης πέρι τί ποτʼ ἐστὶν ἄσκεπτον γένηται

children.definition: unseen, hidden, γάμοι Opp. H. 1.773.
too small to be observed, negligible, ἐν ἀσκέπτῳ χρόνῳ Arist. APo. 89b10.
winter shoe with fur lining, Hippon. 19, Lyc. 855, 1322, Herod. 2.32:— Dim. ἀσκερίσκος, ὁ, metapl. pl. ἀσκερίσκα Hippon. 18.
not made by art, natural, κάλλος Philostr. Im. 2.9.
without the implements of his art, Hdt. 3.131.

children.label: II
children.definition: without furniture, Muson. Fr. 14p.71H.
unfurnished, unprepared, οὐ ψιλὸν οὐδʼ ἄ. S. OC 1029; [ τριήρης] IG 2.804.268, al.: c. gen., ἄ. ἀσπίδων τε καὶ στρατοῦ unfurnished with . . , S. El. 36.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄσκευοι, οἱ, light-armed troops, Paus. 8.50.2.
not searched thoroughly, Str. 8.6.23.
want of consideration, heedlessness, Plb. 2.63.5.

work raw materials, εἴρια, κέρα, Il. 3.388, 4.110; work curiously, form by art, [ κρητῆρα] Σιδόνες πολυδαίδαλοι εὖ ἤσκησαν ib. 23.743; ἑρμῖνʼ ἀσκήσας Od. 23.198; πτύξασα καὶ ἀσκήσασα χιτῶνα having folded and smoothed it, ib. 1.439; ἅρμα . . χρυσῷ καὶ ἀργύρῳ εὖ ἤσκηται Il. 10.438; χορὸν ἤσκησεν ib. 18.592; γόμφοις ἀ. Emp. 87: added in aor. part. to Verbs, [ θρόνον] τεύξει ἀσκήσας elaborately, Il. 14.240; [ χρυσὸν] βοὸς κέρασιν περίχευεν ἀσκήσας Od. 3.437; [ ἑανὸν] ἔξυσʼ ἀσκήσασα Il. 14.179.

data.quote: ἅρμα . . χρυσῷ καὶ ἀργύρῳ εὖ ἤσκηται

children.definition: dress out, trick out, ἀ. τινὰ κόσμῳ Hdt. 3.1; ἐς κάλλος ἀσκεῖ decks herself, E. El. 1073; δέμας Id. Tr. 1023:—freq. in Pass., σκιεροῖς ἠσκημένα γυίοις furnished with . . , Emp. 61.4; πέπλοισι Περσικοῖς ἠσκημένη A. Pers. 182; οὐ χλιδαῖς ἠσκημένον S. El. 452; of buildings, παστὰς ἠσκημένη στύλοισι Hdt. 2.169; Παρίῳ λίθῳ ἠσκημένα Id. 3.57: abs., οἴκημα ἠσκημένον Id. 2.130; σῶμα λόγοις ἠσκ. tricked out with words only, not real, S. El. 1217:— Med., σῶμʼ ὅπλοις ἠσκήσατο adorned his own person, E. Hel. 1379, cf. Alc. 161.
Pi., honour a divinity, do him reverence, δαίμονʼ ἀσκήσω θεραπεύων P. 3.109; ἀσκεῖται Θέμις O. 8.22.

children.label: II
children.definition: practise, exercise, train, esp. in Prose and Com., properly of athletic exercise,

ἀ. τὸν υἱὸν τὸν ἐπιχώριον τρόπον Ar. Pl. 47; ἀ. τὰ σώματα εἰς ἰσχύν X. Cyr. 2.1.20, cf. Mem. 1.2.19; ἐχθρὸν ἐφʼ ἡμᾶς αὐτοὺς τηλικοῦτον ἠσκήκαμεν D. 3.28:— Pass., σώματα εὖ ἠσκημένα X. Cyr. 1.6.41; εἰς ἀγῶνα ἄμεινον ἡμῶν ἤσκηνται D. 9.52; ἀσκεῖσθαι λέγειν Luc. Demon. 4; τὴν Κυνικὴν ἄσκησιν Id. Tox. 27; λόγοις D.C. 45.2; ἐν παιδείᾳ Id. 60.2; πρός τι D.S. 2.54.

data.quote: ἀ. τὸν υἱὸν τὸν ἐπιχώριον τρόπον
ἐχθρὸν ἐφʼ ἡμᾶς αὐτοὺς τηλικοῦτον ἠσκήκαμεν

children.definition: ἀ. τέχνην, πεντάεθλον, Hdt. 3.125, 9.33; λόγους Democr. 53a, 110; μανθάνειν καὶ ἀ. τι Pl. Grg. 509e; ἀ. παγκράτιον, στάδιον, etc., Id. Lg. 795b, Thg. 128e; ἠσκηκέναι μηδεμίαν ἄσκησιν κυριωτέραν τῆς πολεμικῆς Arist. Pol. 1271b5: metaph., ἀ. τὴν ἀληθείην, δικαιοσύνην, Hdt. 7.209, 1.96; δίκαια S. OC 913; ἀρετήν E. Fr. 853, Pl. R. 407a; κακότητα A. Pr. 1066 (lyr.), cf. S. Tr. 384; ἀσέβειαν E. Ba. 476; τὰ δίκαια Crates Theb. 12; λαλιάν Ar. Nu. 931 (anap.): c. dupl. acc., ἀ. αὑτόν τε καὶ τοὺς σὺν αὑτῷ τὰ πολεμικά X. Cyr. 8.6.10.

data.quote: ἠσκηκέναι μηδεμίαν ἄσκησιν κυριωτέραν τῆς πολεμικῆς
ἀ. αὑτόν τε καὶ τοὺς σὺν αὑτῷ τὰ πολεμικά

children.definition: inf., ἄσκει τοιαύτη μένειν practise, endeavour to remain such, S. El. 1024; λέγειν ἠσκηκότες Id. Fr. 963; εὐσεβεῖν ἠσκηκότα E. Fr. 1067; ἀ. γαστρὸς κρείττους εἶναι, τοὺς φίλους ἀγαθὰ ποιεῖν, X. Cyr. 4.2.45, 5.5.12, cf. Mem. 2.1.6; ἤσκει ἐξομιλεῖν παντοδαποῖς he made a practice of associating . . , Id. Ages. 11.4.
practise, go into training, Pl. R. 389c, X. Cyr. 2.1.29; οἱ ἀσκέοντες those who practise gymnastics, Hp. Acut. 9; περὶ τὰς βαναύσους τέχνας Plb. 9.20.9.
Pl.Com. 234.

unhurt, unscathed, in Hom. of persons, ἂψ εἰς ἡμέας ἔλθοι ἀ. Il. 10.212; ἀ. ἱκόμην ἐς πατρίδα γαῖαν Od. 9.79, cf. Epich. 99.10, Call. Aet. 3.1.69 [Fr. 75.69]; ἀσκηθέες (trisyll.) καὶ ἄνουσοι Od. 14.255 (v.l. ἀσκεθέες); sound, healthy, IG 4.952.109 (Epid.); ἀ. τινὰ πέμπειν Sol. 19.4; unblemished, IG 5(2).3.5 ( Tegea, iv B. C.); = ἀπαθής, θεός Timo 60, etc.; later of things, ἀ. νόστος safe return, A.R. 2.690; ἀ. μέλι pure, virgin honey, Antim. 16.2. (Perh. from ἀ- priv., and the root of scathe, Germ. schaden ‘hurt’.)

exercise, practice, Hp. Off. 7, X. Cyr. 7.5.79; τὰ εἰς τὸν πόλεμον ἀ. Id. Oec. 11.19, cf. PLond. 3.1164i21 (iii A.D.); in warfare, branch of the service, arm (e.g. elephants or chariots), Arr. Tact. 19.6.
without tents, not under canuas, Plu. Sert. 12, App. BC 5.117.
that cannot be feigned, μανία Ph. 2.522.

definition: ἀσκηρά εἶδός τι τῶν καστανίων, Hsch.

children.definition: exercise, practice, training, ἐξ ἀσκήσιος ἀγαθοὶ γίνονται Democr. 242, cf. Protag. 3, Pl. Prt. 323d, al.; γυμνασίων καὶ ἀσκησίων ἐπιμελόμενοι Hp. VM 4, cf. Th. 2.39; πολεμική X. Cyr. 8.1.34; ἱππική IG 2.478b18: in pl., exercises, ἔθεσικαὶ ἀσκήσεσι Pl. R. 518e, cf. Plt. 294d.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄ. τινος practice of or in a thing, Th. 5.67; ἀρετῆς X. Mem. 1.2.20; δειλίας ἀλλʼ οὐκ ἀνδρείας Pl. Lg. 791b.

children.label: III
children.definition: mode of life, profession, Luc. Vit.Auct. 7; of a philosophical sect, ἡ Κυνικὴ ἄ. Id. Tox. 27.

children.label: IV
children.definition: adornment, τῶν τριχῶν Aeschin.Socr. 18.
to be practised, X. Cyr. 5.3.43, Jul. Ep. 89.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀσκητέον one must practise, σοφίαν, σωφροσύνην, Pl. Grg. 487c, 507d; ποῖα πρὸς ποίους ἀ. Arist. Pol. 1325a13.

definition: ἀσκητήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, = sq., Poet. ap. Gal. Protr. 13 (leg. ἀσκήτορες.)

children.definition: one who practises any art or trade, ἀ. τῶν καλῶν κἀγαθῶν ἔργων, opp. ἰδιώτης, X. Cyr. 1.5.11; λόγων D.H. Is. 2; σοφίης IG 3.1322; esp. = ἀθλητής, Ar. Pl. 585, Pl. R. 403e sq., Isoc. 2.11; Διόνυσος ἀ., title of comedy by Aristomenes.

children.label: II
children.definition: hermit or monk, Ph. 1.643.
laborious, βίος Pl. Lg. 806a; ἀ. νόσημα such as is incident to an athlete, Ar. Lys. 1085; of persons, Ph. 1.552. Adv. -κῶς Poll. 3.145.

children.label: II
children.definition: ascetic, μελέται Ph. 1.646.
curiously wrought, νῆμα Od. 4.134; λέχος 23.189; χρίματα Xenoph. 3.6; εἵματα Theoc. 24.140; adorned, decked, πέπλῳ with . . , Id. 1.33, cf. AP 6.219.3 (Antip.). Adv. -τῶς prob.l. in Simon. 157.
to be got or reached by practice, οὐ διδακτὸν ἀλλʼ ἀ., of virtue, Pl. Men. 70a, cf. X. Mem. 1.2.23; μαθητὸν ἢ ἐθιστὸν ἢ καὶ ἄλλως πως ἀ. Arist. EN 1099b10.

data.quote: μαθητὸν ἢ ἐθιστὸν ἢ καὶ ἄλλως πως ἀ.

children.label: II
children.definition: exercised, practised in a thing, Ἀθηναίης παλάμῃσιν Simon. l.c. (codd. D.L.); ἀνὴρ ἀ. καὶ σοφός Plu. Lyc. 30.
ἀ. γυναῖκες Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.225.29, cf. Anatolian Studies p.81.
unshaded, Onos. 10.5, Eust. 1550.63.

children.label: II
children.definition: not clouded by rust, etc., Maria ap. Zos.Alch. p.152 B., cf. ib. 182 B.
clear from rust, Zos.Alch. p.183B.:—hence ἀσκῐάστ-ωσις, εως, ἡ, ib. 217 B.

definition: ἀσκίδιον, τό, = sq., Ar. Ec. 307, Posidon. 30.

children.definition: Dim. of ἀσκός, Hp. Liqu. 6, Aff. 21, Plu. Art. 12: prov. of empty threats, οὐκ ἀσκίῳ μορμολύττεσθαι Crates Com. 8.
unshaded, ὄρεα Pi. N. 6.45 (v.l. δασκίοις) ; αὐγή, ἀκτῖνες, Ph. 1.485, 579.

children.label: II
children.definition: shadowless, Theopomp.Hist. 313, Cleom. 1.10, Str. 17.1.48, Hld. 9.22.

children.label: III
children.definition: Zos.Alch. p.183 B.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἀ- intens.) dull, of colour, Thphr. Sens. 78.
ἄσκιος ὕλη· ἡ δασεῖα ὕλη, Hsch.
not leaning on a staff, AP 9.298 ( Antiphil.), 7.732 ( Theodorid.); but ἀσκείπωνι γονῇ γῆρας ἐρειδόμενοι a child too young to serve as a staff, BMus.Inscr. 2.390.
dropsy, ascites, Epicur. Fr. 190, Aret. SD 1.16, Gal. 17(2).670.

children.label: II
children.definition: patient suffering from the disease, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.8.9.
swallow-wort, Vincetoxicum officinale, Dsc. 3.92, Gal. 11.840.
Dsc. 4.148 Wellm.
Hsch.
bleeding from haemorrhoids, Sever. Clyst. p.35 D.

Asclepios, Il. 2.731, h.Hom. 16, etc.:— hence Ἀσκληπιάδης, ου, ὁ, son of Asclepios, Il. 4.204, al.: in pl., as a name for physicians, Thgn. 432, Pl. R. 405d: also Ἀσκληπίδης, ου, ὁ, in pl., S. Ph. 1333:— Ἀσκληπιασταί, Dor. Ἀσκλᾱπ-, οἱ, guild of worshippers of A., IG 2.617 b, 12(1).162 ( Rhodes), etc.:— Ἀσκληπιεῖον, τό, temple of Asclepios, Plb. 1.18.2, Str. 17.3.14; -ίεια, τά, festival of A., Pl. Ion 530a, IG 2.741 A a14, etc. (also Ἀσκληπίδεια ib. 5 (1).659 ( Sparta)):— Ἀσκληπιακός, ή, όν, Aristid. Or. 47(23).58, Dam. Pr. 95:— Ἀσκληπιάδειος [ στίχος], ὁ, metre employed by Ἀσκληπιάδης, POxy. 220 xiv 9, Heph. 10.3: also Ἀ., ὁ, physician of the school of Asclepiades, Gal. 11.794. ( Ἀσκληπιοῦ is for -ῐόο in Il. 2.731. D. is said to have made it proparox. Ἀσκλήπιος, deriving it from ἤπιος, Plu. VOrat. 2.845b.)
string for wineskins, Nic. Th. 928.
flay a person and make a bag of his skin, Ps.-Callisth. 3.8.
leathern bag, Ar. Fr. 174, Archipp. 4, Diocl.Com. 3.

definition: ἀσκόλαχα ἀσκαλαβώτης, Hsch. ἀσκόομαι, only aor. 1 ἀσκώσατο (sic) · ἠχθέσθη, Id.

children.definition: free from intrusions, πενία ἀ. οὐσία Secund. Sent. 10.
scrip, wallet, Ar. Fr. 577, Diph. 55.2, prob. in Suet. Ner. 45.
inconsiderate, heedless, Il. 24.157, Timo 5, etc.; ὄμμα Parm. 1.35; ἄσκοποί τινος unregardful of . . , A. Ag. 462 (lyr.). Adv. -πως heedlessly, Babr. 95.39.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., not to be seen, invisible, πλάκες ἄ., of the nether world, S. OC 1682 (lyr.), cf. E. Hyps.Fr. 57.21 (lyr.).

not to be understood, unintelligible, ἔπος A. Ch. 816 (lyr.), cf. S. Ph. 1111 (lyr.); πρᾶγος Id. Aj. 21; ἄ. χρόνος unknown time, Id. Tr. 246; unimaginable, ἄ. ἁ λώβα Id. El. 864 (lyr.); bewildering, strange, ἤργασαι δέ μʼ ἄσκοπα ib. 1315.
unconsidered, Gal. 7.432.

aimless, βέλος D.H. 8.86; κίνησις Phlp. in Ph. 846.25; ἄσκοπα τοξεύειν Luc. Tox. 62. Adv. -πως, εἰκῇ καὶ ἀ. χρήσασθαι τοῖς πράγμασιν Plb. 4.14.6; πλανώμενος ἀ. Plu. Dio 49; ἀ. λόγους ῥίπτειν Longus 4.31, cf. Ath.Mech. 3.9, Cleom. 2.4, Phlp. in Ph. 902.19; οὐκ ἀ. εἰκάζειν J. AJ 2.2.3, cf. Gal. 18(1).768, Alex.Aphr. Pr.Anecd. I.

data.quote: -πως, εἰκῇ καὶ ἀ. χρήσασθαι τοῖς πράγμασιν

children.definition: leathern canteen, Antiph. 150, Men. 266, LXX Ju. 10.5.
not stretching oneʼs limbs, Com.Adesp. 952.

skin, hide, PFay. 121.9 (i/ii A. D.); but usually, skin made into a bag, esp. wineskin, οἶνον . . ἀσκῷ ἐν αἰγείῳ Il. 3.247, Od. 6.78; ἀσκὸν . . μέλανος οἴνοιο 5.265, 9.196; ἀσκὸς βοός, of the bag in which Aeolus bottled up the winds, Od. 10.19, cf. 45, 57; ἀσκοὺς καμήλων skins of camelʼs hide, Hdt. 3.9; ἀ. Μαρσύεω bag made from the skin of Marsyas, Id. 7.26; ἀ. ἀφύσητος Hp. Art. 47; εἴ μοι ἡ δορὰ μὴ εἰς ἀσκὸν τελευτήσει ὥσπερ ἡ Μαρσύου Pl. Euthd. 285c; ἀσκοῖς καὶ θυλάκοις X. An. 6.4.23, cf. Th. 4.26; ἀσκοὶ πεφυσαμένοι, of mankind, Epich. 246; ἄνθρωποι κενεῆς οἰήσιος ἔμπλεοι ἀ. Timo 11; ἀσκός, of the human skin, Ph. 2.462.

data.quote: εἴ μοι ἡ δορὰ μὴ εἰς ἀσκὸν τελευτήσει ὥσπερ ἡ Μαρσύου

children.definition: paunch, belly, Archil. 72; in oracular language, E. Med. 679, Plu. Thes. 3.
bellows, Plb. 21.28.15, Ath. 10.456d.
bagpipes, Gal. 4.459.

wineskin, of a toper, Antiph. 19: prov., ἀεί ποτʼ εὖ μὲν ἀ. εὖ δὲ θύλακος ἅνθρωπός ἐστι Alex. 85; " ἀσκός, πέλεκυς" in a childʼs game, Thphr. Char. 5.5; ἀσκὸν δείρειν flay alive, hence, abuse, maltreat, Ar. Nu. 442:— Pass., ἀσκὸς δεδάρθαι Sol. 33.7.

data.quote: ἀεί ποτʼ εὖ μὲν ἀ. εὖ δὲ θύλακος ἅνθρωπός ἐστι

definition: ἀσκότονοι κυνορραῖσται, κρότωνες, Hsch. ἀσκουρῶτις· ἄ<ρ>κτος ἡ (cod. ἢ) μικρά Id.

children.definition: bear wineskins at the feast of Bacchus, AB 214:— Adj. ἀσκο-φόρος, ον, ibid.
not pillaged or stripped, D.H. 11.27, Hld. 1.1.

not pulled about, Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.47.5, Philum. ap. Aët. 9.23; undisturbed, S.E. P. 1.71, POxy. 532.14 (ii A.D.); ἱερὸν ἄ. IG 12(9).15 ( Carystus). Adv. -τως without being mangled or hurt, Eust. 1252.55.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., without causing laceration, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.7.1: Comp. -ότερον Sor. 1.3.
St. Johnʼs wort, Hypericum perforatum, Dsc. 3.155, Gal. 11.829.
without cup, Hippoloch. ap. Ath. 4.129f.
not worm-eaten, PGrad. 7.11 (iii B. C.).

definition: Ἀσκώλια, τά, second day of the rural Dionysia, Sch. Ar. Pl. 1129.

children.definition: hop on greased wineskins at the Ἀσκώλια, Ar. Pl. 1129 (cf. Sch.).

children.label: II
children.definition: hop on one leg, ἀσκωλιάζειν ῥᾷον ἐπὶ τοῖς ἀριστεροῖς Arist. IA 705b33, cf. Ael. NA 3.13, Plu. QConv. 2.621f, Gal. 11.106; also, jump up and down with legs held together, Sch. Orib. 3p.689D. (Signf. II may be original and the connexion with ἀσκός due to popular etymology.)
leaping on greased wineskins, Poll. 9.21.
Pl. Smp. 190d, Phryn. PS p.42B.
leather padding or lining of the hole which served for the rowlock, Ar. Ach. 97, Ra. 364.
swelling, such as on the female breast, Ruf. Onom. 92, cf. Poll. 2.163.
leathern bellows, Apollod. Poliorc. 153.3:— Dim. ἀσκωμ-άτιον, τό, Hero Spir. 1.39.
AB 452; cf. ἄττω.
song, esp. lyric ode, hymn, Pl. Prt. 343csq., Alex. 19, Luc. Salt. 16; ᾆ. μετὰ χοροῦ SIG 648 B 7 ( Delph., ii B. C.).
noiseless, Opp. H. 3.428.

definition: ᾀσμάτιον, τό, Dim. of ᾆσμα, Pl.Com. 235.

children.definition: twister of song, of Trag. and Dithyrambic poets, Ar. Nu. 333:—hence ᾀσμᾰτο-καμπέω, Tz. in An.Ox. 3.339.
repeat songs, Artem. 1.76.
composer of songs, Ath. 5.181e.
Din. 1.34 ἀσμενεῖν μεταβολήν wish for a change.

definition: ἀσμενής, ές, dub. l. in Arist. Phgn. 807b35.

children.definition: take or receive gladly, τι Plb. 6.8.3; ἀγλαΐαν Plot. 5.8.12; ἐπιστήμην, λόγους, Them. Or. 33.364d, 8.107b; τὸν Ἰουδαϊσμόν Porph. Chr. 27: intr., to be satisfied with a thing, τινί Plb. 3.97.5; τῇ ἡδονῇ Muson. Fr. 6p.27H., cf. Agathin. ap. Orib. 10.7.10, Ph. 2.37, etc.; ἀ. εἰ . . Plb. 4.11.5: c. part., ἀ. ἐσθίοντες Plu. Virt. et vit. 2.101d; ὡς χρησόμενοι App. BC 3.40:— Med. as Dep., Aesop. 45.
gratification, Ph. 1.450; a form of ἡδονή, Stoic. 3.97.
one must take a thing gladly, Hp. Dent. 25, Gal. 8.816, 10.648.
acceptable, welcome, S.E. M. 11.85, Plot. 6.7.30, Them. Or. 16.205c; τινί J. AJ 19.6.4.

well-pleased, glad, always with a Verb, φύγεν ἄ. ἐκ θανάτοιο he was glad to have escaped death, Il. 20.350, cf. Od. 9.63, Pi. O. 13.74: freq. in Trag. and Att., ἄσμενος δὲ τἂν . . κάμψειεν γόνυ A. Pr. 398; ἐκ θαλάσσης ἀσμένους πεφευγότας E. Hel. 398; ἄ. αἱρεθείς Th. 6.12; ἐκάθευδον ἄ. ἥκων ἐξ ἀγροῦ Lys. 1.13; ἀσμένας εἰς τὸν λειμῶνα ἀπιούσας Pl. R. 614e: freq. in dat., ἐμοὶ δέ κεν ἀσμένῳ εἴη glad would it make me ! Il. 14.108; ἀσμένῳ δέ σοι . . νὺξ ἀποκρύψει φάος glad wilt thou be when night shuts out the light, A. Pr. 23; ὥς σφι ἀσμένοισι ἡμέρα ἐπέλαμψε Hdt. 8.14; ἀσμένῃ δέ μοι . . ἦλθε S. Tr. 18; ὡς ἀσμένοισιν ἦλθες Ar. Pax 582, cf. Pl. Cra. 418c, etc. Adv. ἀσμένως gladly, readily, A. Pr. 728, D. 18.36, Alex. 142, Timocl. 14 (this Adv., which is common in later Greek, Act.Ap. 21.17, etc., has sts. been substituted for the Adj., as in Th. 4.21 (v. l.)): Sup. ἀσμεναίτατα (v.l. -έστατα) Pl. R. 329c; -έστατα ib. 616a (though the Adj. makes -ώτερος, -ώτατος, Hp. Art. 8, cf. Phryn. PS p.18B.). (Not to be connected with ἁνδάνω, since there is no ancient authority for rough breathing ἁσμ-.)
not cleansed with soap, Pherecr. 195.
Pl.Com. 235.

definition: ἀσμόσσει ἀγνοεῖ, ἀναπνεῖ, Hsch.: ἀσμωλεῖν ἀγνοεῖν, EM 155.33: ἀσμωλή· ἀναπνοὴ ὀλίγη, ibid.

children.definition: = sq., Eust. 591.9. Adv. -τως Id. 316.32.
not barbarous, S. Fr. 629.
correct, without solecism, Zeno Stoic. 1.23. Adv. -κως AB 452.

children.label: II
children.definition: uncorrupted, unspoiled, κρέας Eub. 7.8; ἀ. παιδιά not coarse, refined, Plu. Cleom. 13; of persons, unexceptionable, Phld. Acad.Ind. p.52 M. Adv. -κως Id. Vit. p.7J.
Hsch., EM 155.34.
folly, stupidity, Plu. Pyrrh. 29, Luc. Astr. 2; rejected by Poll. 4.13.
not deluded by fallacies, Arr. Epict. 1.7.26; ἀ. λόγων παρασκευαῖς J. Ap. 2.41.
unwise, foolish, Thgn. 370, Pi. O. 3.45, Ep.Eph. 5.15, Plu. Alex. fort. 2.330a: Comp., Them. Or. 15.185a. Adv. -φως D.S. 2.29, Lib. Decl. 2.27.

definition: ἄσπα ἥπιος, ἡ ἐγγία, Hsch. (Perh.Persian asp = ἵππος.) ἀσπάζει· συμπεριπατεῖ, Id.

children.definition: welcome kindly, greet, τινά Hom., etc.: freq. c. dat. modi, δεξιῇ ἠσπάζοντο ἔπεσσί τε μειλιχίοισι Il. 10.542; χερσίν Od. 3.35, al.; ἁδυπνόῳ φωνᾷ Pi. I. 2.25; μεγάλως ἠσπάζοντο αὐτόν received him with great joy, Hdt. 1.122, cf. 3.1; παρὰ τὴν πόσιν φιλοφρόνως ἀ. Id. 2.121.δʹ; εὖ νιν ἀσπάσασθε A. Ag. 524: freq. with no modal word, S. OT 596, etc.; esp. as the common form on meeting, Στρεψιάδην ἀσπάζομαι Ar. Nu. 1145, cf. Pl. 1042 (v. Sch.), Pl. Euthd. 273c; αὐτὸν ἠσπάζοντο καὶ ἐδεξιοῦνθʼ Ar. Pl. 752; πόρρωθεν ἀ. salute from a distance, Pl. Chrm. 153b; πρόσωθεν αὐτὴν ἁγνὸς ὢν ἀ. I salute her at a respectful distance, i. e. keep away from her, E. Hipp. 102, cf. Pl. R. 499a; ἀ. ταῖς κώπαις, of the saluting of ships, Plu. Ant. 76; ἀ. τινὰ βασιλέα to hail or salute as king, D.H. 4.39: metaph., ἀ. συμφοράν to bid the event welcome, E. Ion 587.

children.label: b
children.definition: take leave of, Id. Tr. 1276; τὰ ὕστατα ἀ. take a last farewell, Lys. 13.39.

kiss, embrace, Ar. V. 607; ἀ. τοῖς στόμασι Plu. Rom. 1; of dogs, fawn, X. Mem. 2.3.9, Pl. R. 376a; cling fondly to, ἴσον σʼ ὡς τεκοῦσʼ ἀσπάζομαι E. Ion 1363, cf. X. Cyr. 1.3.2; ἐγὼ ὑμᾶς ἀ. καὶ φιλῶ Pl. Ap. 29d: metaph., φιλεῖν καὶ ἀ. τὸ ἄδικον Id. Lg. 689a.
follow eagerly, cleave to, ἀ. τὸ ὅμοιον, οἶνον, Id. Smp. 192a, R. 475a, cf. S.E. M. 11.44; of dogs, ἀ. τὰ ἴχνη X. Cyn. 3.7.
ἀ. ὅτι . . to be glad that . . , Ar. Pl. 324.
inf., to be ready to . . , εὐωχεῖσθαι Philostr. VA 2.7, cf. 31, VS 2.25.4. ( Act. ἀσπάζω in letters (cf. I. C), POxy. 1158.18 (iii A. D.), al., cf. ἀσπάζομαι· ἀσπάζω, Hsch.
not struck close with the σπάθη: hence, either loosely woven or not woven (i. e. of skin), χλαῖνα S. Fr. 877: generally, not in close order, φάλαγξ D.H. 16.3.

definition: ἀσπαίρω, impf. ἤσπαιρον, Ion. and Ep. ἀσπαίρεσκον Q.S. 11.104: ( ἀ- euph., σπαίρω):—

children.definition: pant, gasp, struggle, in Hom. always of the dying (so κραδίη ἀσπαίρουσα must be taken, Il. 13.443), περὶ δουρὶ ἤσπαιρʼ ὡς ὅτε βοῦς κτλ. ib. 571; ζωὸν ἔτʼ ἀσπαίροντα 12.203, cf. Od. 19.229, A. Pers. 977 (lyr.), E. IA 1587; νεκροὶ -οντες Antipho 2.4.5; ἀ. ἄνω κάτω E. El. 843; of an infant, Hdt. 1.111; of fish taken out of the water, Id. 9.120, Babr. 6.5:—but in Hdt. 8.5 Ἀδείμαντος ἤσπαιρε μοῦνος was the only one who still made a struggle, resisted; ἐβόων τε καὶ ἤσπαιρον D.H. 7.25.—Poet. and Ion. word.
Com.Adesp. 953:— ἀσπᾰκῶς· φιλοφρόνως, Hsch.

definition: ἀσπάλαθος [ πᾰ], ὁ, Ar. Fr. 749, but more commonly ἡ, as Pherecr. 109 (s. v.l.), Thphr. Od. 33:—name of a

children.definition: spinous shrub, yielding a fragrant oil, = ἐρυσίσκηπτρον, camelʼs thorn, Alhagi maurorum, Thphr. 9.7.3, Od. 33, Dsc. 1.20.
thorny trefoil, Calycotome villosa, Thgn. 1193 (pl.), Arist. Pr. 906b11, Theoc. 4.57 (pl.), 24.89.
Genista acanthoclada, used as an instrument of torture, ἐπʼ ἀσπαλάθων τινὰ κνάμπτειν Pl. R. 616a.

definition: ἀσπάλαξ [ πᾰ], ακος, ὁ, elsewh. σπάλαξ (q. v.),

children.definition: blind-rat, Spalax typhlus, Arist. HA 533a3, Antig. Mir. 10, Stoic. 2.51, Ael. NA 17.10; ἀσπαλάκων αὐτόχθονα φῦλα Opp. C. 2.612: prov., τυφλότερος ἀσπάλακος Diogenian. 8.25.
angling, Hsch., Suid.; perh. f.l. for -ιεία.
angle, Suid.:— Act., fut. -εύσω, metaph. of a lover, Aristaen. 1.17; ἀσπαλίσαι· ἁλιεῦσαι, σαγηνεῦσαι, AB 183, may be f.l. for ἀσπαλιεῦσαι.

definition: ἀσπαλιεύς, έως, ὁ, = sq., Nic. Th. 704, Opp. H. 3.29, al.

children.definition: angler, Pl. Sph. 218e, Aen.Gaz. Thphr. p.16B.
of or for an angler: -κή (sc. τέχνη), ἡ, angling, Pl. Sph. 219d, 221a, Gal. Thras. 30.
Id. ἀσπάνιον· πάσσαλον, Id.
superfluity, Teles p. 44 H.

definition: ἀσπαραγία, ἀσπάραγος, ἀσπαραγωνία, v. sub ἀσφ-.

children.definition: not causing laceration, τάσις Heliod. (?) ap. Orib. 49.4.46.
Arist. PA 696a20, Resp. 471b13.
unsown, untilled, Od. 9.123; but ἡ ἄ. the sea, Lib. Eth. 24.4.
not sown, growing wild, Od. 9.109, Numen. ap. Ath. 9.371b.

definition: ἀσπάσιος [ πᾰ], α, ον, also ος, ον, Od. 23.233, Luc. Nec. 1:—

children.definition: welcome, gladly welcomed, ἀσπασίη τρίλλιστος ἐπήλυθε νύξ Il. 8.488, cf. 10.35; ὡς δʼ ὅτʼ ἄν ἀσπάσιος βίοτος παίδεσσι φανήῃ πατρός Od. 5.394, etc. Adv. -ίως, ἀ. δʼ ἄρα τῷ κατέδυ φάος ἠελίοιο 13.33.

data.quote: ὡς δʼ ὅτʼ ἄν ἀσπάσιος βίοτος παίδεσσι φανήῃ πατρός
-ίως, ἀ. δʼ ἄρα τῷ κατέδυ φάος ἠελίοιο

children.label: II
children.definition: well-pleased, glad, ἀσπάσιοι δʼ ἐπέβαν γαίης 23.238; ἀσπάσιον δʼ ἄρα τόν γε θεοὶ κακότητος ἔλυσαν they released him to his joy, 5.397. Adv. -ίως gladly, Hom. with a Verb, to be glad to . . , as φημί μιν ἀσπασίως γόνυ κάμψειν Il. 7.118, cf. 18.232, Od. 4.523, etc.— Ep., exc. in Adv. -ίως with glad welcome, A. Ag. 1555 (lyr.); gladly, Hdt. 7.152, Jul. Or. 2.71a.

definition: ἄσπασμα, ατος, τό, = sq., esp. in pl.,

children.definition: embraces, E. Hec. 829, Ph. 2.77, Artem. 1.10, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: thing embraced, dear one, Plu. Cons.ux. 2.608e.
greeting, embrace, Thgn. 860 (pl.); οἱ ἔσχατοι, οἱ τελευταῖοι ἀ., D.H. 4.4, Ph. 2.45: generally, salutation, Ev.Matt. 23.7, Ev.Marc. 12.38, POxy. 471.67 (ii A. D.), Gal. 10.76, Prisc.p.316 D.
affection, opp. μῖσος, Pl. Lg. 919e.
one must welcome, Pl. Phlb. 32d, Iamb. Protr. 5.
friendly, ἔντευξις Plb. 28.3.10; used in salutation, δάκτυλος Gal. 14.451. Adv. -κῶς, ἐδέξατο τὴν ἀπόκρισιν Phld. Acad. Ind. p.41 M.

welcome, Hom. (only in Od.), Ὀδυσῆʼ ἀσπαστὸν ἔδυ φάος ἠελίοιο 13.35, cf. 5.398, 23.239; κάρτα ἀ. [τὸ πρᾶγμα] ἐποιήσαντο Hdt. 5.98; τοῖσι ἡ τυραννὶς πρὸ ἐλευθερίης ἦν ἀσπαστότερον 1.62, cf. E. Rh. 348 (lyr.), Them. Or. 15.184d ( Comp.). Adv. -τῶς Hdt. 4.201, Lyc. 1090; τὸ τῆς ζωῆς ἀ. Epicur. Ep. 3p.61U.; neut. ἀσπαστόν as Adv., Hes. Sc. 42.

data.quote: τοῖσι ἡ τυραννὶς πρὸ ἐλευθερίης ἦν ἀσπαστότερον

children.definition: to be welcomed, Pl. Phlb. 32d.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄσπαστον, τό, an instrument of uncertain use, BGU 544.25 (ii/iii A.D.).

definition: ἀσπαστύς, ύος, ἡ, Ion. for ἀσπασμός, Call. Fr. 427.
ἄσπεδος, ὁ, dub. in Epich. 42; perh. ἀσπέτους as Adj. shd. be read.

children.definition: to be appeased by no libations, implacable, D. 25.52; κότος Nic. Th. 367; πόλεμοι ἄσπειστοι, = ἄσπονδοι, Plu. Inv. 2.537b, cf. S.E. P. 3.175.
without the right to a loan of seed, PTeb. 61.307, 67.97, PAmh. 2.90.6, etc.
without seed, i.e. posterity, Il. 20.303, Luc. Am. 35: metaph., καρπὸς λόγου Max.Tyr. 31.5:—in literal sense, opp. πολύσπερμος, Arist. GA 725b29; of plants, Thphr. HP 7.4.4.
hotly, unceasingly, Hom., who uses only the neut. form as Adv., esp. in phrase ἀσπερχὲς μενεαίνεις Il. 4.32; ἀ. κεχολῶσθαι 16.61, al. ( ἀ- intens., σπέρχομαι.)

unspeakable, unutterable; mostly in sense of unspeakably great, ἄ. αἰθήρ, ῥόος Ὠκεανοῖο, ὕλη, ὕδωρ, Il. 8.558, 18.403, 23.127, Od. 5.101; ἀλκή Il. 16.157; less freq. of number, countless, ἄσπετα πολλά Od. 4.75; κρέα ἄσπετα 9.162; τρεῖτʼ ἄσπετον ye tremble unspeakably, Il. 17.332, cf. Q.S. 11.127; φωνὴ ῥεῖ ἄσπετος flows on unceasingly, h.Ven. 237; ἄσπετος αἰών endless time, Emp. 16.—Chiefly Epic, but found in Lyric, ἄσπετοι μέριμναι B. 18.34, and rarely in Trag., θαῦμα S. Tr. 961 (lyr.); χάλαζα E. Tr. 78; δρυὸς ἄ. ἔρνος Cyc. 615 (lyr.); later Prose, λείας ἄ. πλῆθος f.l. for ἄπλετον, Plb. 3.92.8. ( ἀ- priv. + root seqṷ, cf. ἔννεπε, ἔσπετε ( *ἐν-σπετε), Lat. insece.) A lengthd. form ἀάσπετος is used by Q.S. 3.673, 7.193, al.
one that throws away his shield, runaway, Ar. V. 592.
shield, IG 2.720 B i 16 (iv B.C.), cf. Rev.Épigr. 1.239 ( Naples, ii A.D.): pl., defined as αἱ πτυχαὶ τῶν ἀσπίδων, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: prow of a ship, Id.

children.label: III
children.definition: POxy. 473.8 (ii A. D.), BGU 362 x 6 (iii A. D.).
shield-wielding, λεώς A. Ag. 825.
shield-bearing, of warriors, A. Th. 19; κῶμος ἀ. E. Supp. 390: Subst., Id. Ba. 781.
Dim. of ἀσπίς, small shield, Hermipp. 16, IG 2.61.34, Men. 765, etc.

Dim. of ἀσπίς, boss, Sch. Il. 5.743; wide end of a clyster-pipe, Cael.Aur. TP 4.3:—also ἀσπῐδ-ίσκη, ἡ, boss, disk, Jahresh. 16 Beibl. 51 ( Athens, iii B. C.), SIG 2588.31 ( Delos, ii B. C.), Ausonia 10.171 ( Perga), LXX Ex. 36.26 ( 39.18); small shield, Ascl. Tact. 1.2, Hero Dioptr. 5, etc.; name of a constellation, Ptol. Alm. 8.1: ἀσπιδίσκιον, τό, IG 2.733 A ii 7, Dsc. 3.91, Gal. 14.724; and ἀσπῐδ-ισκάριον, τό, Lyd. Mag. 1.11.
shield-bearing, a warrior, ἀνέρες ἀσπιδιῶται Il. 2.554, 16.167, Theoc. 14.67, Plb. 10.29.6, AP 9.116: in Pl., = Lat. scutati, Lyd. Mag. 1.9:—so ἀσπῐδίτης [ δῑ], ου, ὁ, S. Fr. 426.
bitten by an adder or asp, Dsc. 2.34, Vett.Val. 127.20, Gal. 14.300.
clattering with shields, Pi. I. 1.23.
shaped like a shield, Agatharch. 105.

children.label: II
children.definition: adorned with serpents, βασιλεῖαι OGI 90.44 ( Rosetta).
= ἀσπιδοειδής, Poet. ap. S.E. M. 1.316, cf. Opp. H. 1.397; but perh. shield-covered, and so of the testudo, formed by shields, Id. C. 1.214.
snake-hunter, Gloss.
shield-manufactory, D. 36.4, Poll. 7.155, Lib. Or. 33.17.
shield-maker, Poll. 1.149, Them. Or. 15.197c.
the making of the shield, Gramm. name for Il. 18, Hermog. Prog. 2, Eust. 1154.41.
shield-maker, Poll. 7.155.
feeding on adders or asps, Gal. 11.143.
shield-bearer, S. Fr. 427, E. Supp. 1144.
living by the shield, i.e. by war, ἀ. θίασος E. Ph. 796 (lyr.).
bear a shield, Sch. Ar. Nu. 984.

definition: ἀσπιδοφορικός, ή, όν, = sq.: -κή (sc. τέχνη), ἡ, Eustr. in EN 11.27.

children.definition: bearing a shield, Thd. 2 Ki. 11.4.
shield, protect, τόπον IGRom. 4.1349 ( Lydia): pf. part. ἠσπικότες Hsch., Suid.

stainless: hence, faultless, without blemish, λίθοι IG 2.1054c4, cf. AP 6.252 ( Antiphil.), 1 Ep.Ti. 6.14, 1 Ep.Pet. 1.19, etc.; ἄ. ἀπὸ παντὸς κινδύνου PMag.Leid.V. 8.11: Comp. and Sup. vv. ll. for sq. in Dsc. 2.167.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄσπιλος· χειμάρρους (Maced.), Hsch.

definition: ἀσπίλωτος, ον, = foreg. [ἄσπιλος] I, Sext. Sent. 449, Suid.;

children.definition: without spots, Dsc. 2.167.

definition: ἀσπίνθιον, τό, prob. a vulgar form of ἀψίνθιον, Hsch.:—also ἀπίνθιον, EM 183.25.

children.definition: shield, εὔκυκλος Il. 14.428, al.; κυκλοτερής Hdt. 1.194; ἀσπίδος κύκλος A. Th. 489; ὀμφαλόεσσα Il. 4.448, al.; opp. Thracian πέλτη and Persian γέρρον, X. An. 2.1.6, Mem. 3.9.2; ἀσπίδα ῥῖψαι, ἀποβαλεῖν, Anacr. 28, Ar. V. 19, cf. Hdt. 5.95: to estimate a victory, ἀσπίδας ἔλαβον ὡς διακοσίας X. HG 1.2.3: metaph., οὗτος γὰρ ἡμῖν ἀ. οὐ μικρὰ θράσους A. Ag. 1437; τὴν ἀ. ἀποβέβληκεν τοῦ βίου Nicostr.Com. 29, cf. Lib. Or. 62.47.

data.quote: οὗτος γὰρ ἡμῖν ἀ. οὐ μικρὰ θράσους

children.definition: body of men-at-arms, ὀκτακισχιλίη ἀ. Hdt. 5.30, cf. E. Ph. 78, X. An. 1.7.10.

ἐπʼ ἀσπίδας πέντε καὶ εἴκοσι τάξασθαι to be drawn up twenty-five deep or in file, Th. 4.93; στρατιὰν τεταγμένην οὐκ ἐπʼ ὀλίγων ἀσπίδων Id. 7.79; ἵστασθαι ἐπὶ τρεῖς ἀσπίδας Ar. Fr. 66; ἐπὶ μιᾶς ἀσπίδος in single line, Isoc. 6.99; ἐπʼ ἀσπίδα, παρʼ ἀσπίδα (opp. ἐπὶ δόρυ), on the left, towards or to the left, because the shield was on the left arm, X. Cyr. 7.5.6, An. 4.3.26; παρʼ ἀσπίδος A. Th. 624; ἐξ ἀσπίδος Plb. 11.23.5; but παρʼ ἀσπίδα, literally, beside the shield, Il. 16.400; παρʼ ἀ. στῆναι stand in battle, E. Med. 250, Ph. 1001; παρʼ ἀ. βεβηκέναι ib. 1073; ἐκπονεῖν Id. Or. 653, cf. Hel. 734; ἐς ἀσπίδʼ ἥξειν Id. Ph. 1326; ἀσπίδας συγκλείειν (cf. συγκλείω) ; ἀσπίδα τίθεσθαι serve in the ranks, Pl. Lg. 756a; but θέσθαι τὰς ἀ. pile shields, X. HG 2.4.12; ἐπειδὰν ἀ. ψοφῇ when the shields ring, i.e. when two bodies of men meet in a charge, Id. An. 4.3.29; ἀσπίδα ἀναδέξαι, ἆραι, as a signal, Hdt. 6.115, X. HG 2.1.27.

data.quote: στρατιὰν τεταγμένην οὐκ ἐπʼ ὀλίγων ἀσπίδων

children.definition: Aristopho 14.
boss on a door, IG 4.1484.79 (Epid.).

children.label: II
children.definition: asp, Egyptian cobra, Coluber haié, Hdt. 4.191, Men. 702, Nic. Th. 158, Ph. 2.570, Ael. NA 10.31; a play on signff. I and II, Ar. V. 23.
ornament in this form, OGI 90.43 ( Rosetta).

definition: ἀσπιστήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, = sq., S. Aj. 565, E. Heracl. 277.

children.definition: one armed with a shield, warrior, Hom. (in Il.) always in gen. pl. ἀσπιστάων, Il. 4.90, al.:—as Adj., ἀσπισταὶ μόχθοι τευχέων, i.e. the shield of Achilles, E. El. 444 (dub.l.).
composed of warriors, φάλαγξ D.H. 20.3.
of shielded warriors, A. Ag. 404 (lyr.).
to be unmerciful, Aq., Thd. Jb. 41.2.
without bowels, or rather, without heart: metaph., dastard, S. Aj. 472; unsympathetic, merciless, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.249. Adv. ἀσπλάγχν-νως Hsch. s.v. ἀνηλεῶς.

children.label: II
children.definition: not eating σπλάγχνα, Pl.Com. 113.

definition: ἄσπληνον, τό (and ἄσπλαγχν-ος, ὁ, Dsc. 3.134), ( ἀ- euph., σπλήν)

children.definition: miltwaste, Asplenium Ceterach, supposed to be a cure for the spleen, Dsc. l.c., Zopyr. ap. Orib. 14.50.1.
spleenless, Aët. 15.14.
ἄσπληνος, ὁ, = κισσός, Ps.- Dsc. 2.179.

definition: ἀσπονδεί (also ἀσπονδ-ί, SIG 110 ( Rhodes, v B.C.), 187 ( Cnidus, iv B. C.), Adv. of ἄσπονδος:—

children.definition: without truce, implacably, πολεμεῖν Ph. 2.195; φονᾶν ib. 423.

children.label: II
children.definition: without formal treaty, ἀσυλεὶ καὶ ἀ. SIG 168.9 ( Erythrae, iv B.C.), IPE 2.1 ( Panticapaeum, iv B.C.), etc.
being without truce or treaty, IG 2(2).28, Poll. 8.139.

children.label: II
children.definition: implacability, Lib. Vit. 1.22 ( -εία codd.).
without σπονδή or drink-offering: hence,

children.label: I
children.definition: to whom no drink-offering is poured, ἄ. θεός, i.e. death, E. Alc. 424.

children.label: II
children.definition: without a regular truce (ratified by σπονδαί) , ἀνοκωχή Th. 5.32; of persons, without making a truce, ἄ. ἀπιέναι Id. 3.111, cf. 113; ἀσπόνδους τοὺς νεκροὺς ἀνελέσθαι take up their dead without leave asked, Id. 2.22; τὸ εὐπρεπὲς ἄσπονδον the specious plea of neutrality, Id. 1.37.

admitting of no truce, implacable, ἄσπονδόν τʼ Ἄρη ( ἀράν codd.) A. Ag. 1235 (Pors.); πόλεμος D. 18.262, Plb. 1.65.6, etc.; ἔχθρα Plu. Per. 30; ἀσπόνδοισι νόμοισιν ἔχθραν συμβάλλειν E. El. 905 (lyr.); of persons, implacable, 2 Ep.Ti. 3.3. Adv. -δως, ἔχειν Ph. Fr. 24H.
to be unsown, of land, PTeb. 61b34 (ii B. C.), etc.; ἀσπορίσαι, written for -ῆσαι, Wilcken Chr. 11 A 8.
barrenness, Man. 4.585.

children.label: II
children.definition: unsown, growing without cultivation, Luc. Rh.Pr. 8, Nic. Fr. 74.58.

children.label: III
children.definition: begotten without impregnation, of Hephaestus, Nonn. D. 9.229; but, producing without impregnation, ἰλύς ib. 40.433.

children.label: IV
children.definition: barren, Luc. Am. 28, Nonn. D. 2.221, al.; not having issue, ib. 40.119.
Act., preventing production, αὐχμός ib. 39.139.
not zealously pursued or courted, γυνή E. Fr. 501; ἀσπούδαστα, τά, matters of no interest, Hp. Ep. 17.
not to be sought for, mischievous, σπεύδειν ἀσπούδαστα E. Ba. 913, IT 202.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not in earnest, τὸ ἀ. want of earnestness, περί τι D.H. 5.72. Adv. -τως carelessly, Ael. NA 10.30, PFlor. 187.3 (iii A. D.).
without effort or trouble, Il. 8.512, 15.476; without a struggle, ignobly, μὴ μὰν ἀσπουδί γε . . ἀπολοίμην 22.304, cf. Arr. An. 6.9.5; carelessly, D.C. 54.18.
without ambition, Eup. 234.
Stoic. 3.38.
rough, i.e. unworn, coin, OGI 484.25 (Pergam.); cf. κόλλυβος· aspratura, Gloss.
Turkey oak, Quercus Cerris, Thphr. HP 3.8.7.
= Lat. asper, Ael. NA 1.26.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄ. γράμματα invisible writing, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.108 (the signf. white is very late); ἄσπρον, τό, white of an egg, [ Gal.] 14.560.

children.label: III
children.definition: ingredient of incense, Aët. 16.146,148.

definition: ἄσσα, Ion. for ἅτινα, neut. pl. of ὅστις, Il. 10.208, al., Hdt. 1.47, al.; Att. ἅττα Pl.Com. 49, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄσσα, Ion. for τινά, Att. ἄττα, something, some, Hom. only once, ὁπποῖʼ ἄσσα what sort, Od. 19.218; πόσʼ ἄττα; Ar. Ra. 173; δείνʼ ἄ. ib. 925; οἷʼ ἄττα βαΰζει Cratin. 6, etc.: with numerals, δύʼ ἄττα ὀνόματα, τρία ἄττα γένη, Pl. Sph. 255c, Ly. 216d: added to a temporal Conj., πηνίκʼ ἄττα . . ; Ar. Av. 1514, etc. ( ἄσσα ( ἄττα) arises from false division of groups like ὁποῖά σσα where σσα = τι-α, neut. pl. of τις, cf. Megarian σά.)
at the rate of 12 asses per denarius per month, τόκος BMus.Inscr. 481*.66 ( Ephesus, ii A.D.).
assarius (sc. nummus)), D.H. 9.27, SIG 2869.5 ( Calymna), OGI 484.9, al. ( Pergam., ii A.D.), Plu. Cam. 13, Ev.Matt. 10.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: valve, Hero Spir. 1.10.

definition: ἀσσέως ἐπὶ σοῦ, Hsch. (Fort. ἆος· ἕως, <μ>έ<χρ>ις οὗ.)

children.definition: essedarius, Artem. 2.32.

definition: ἆσσον ( Dor. ἄσσιον acc. to Eust. 1643.32), Adv. Comp. of ἄγχι:—

children.definition: nearer, esp. of hostile approach, ἆσσον ἴτʼ Il. 1.567, al., cf. Hes. Th. 748; τείχεος ἆ. ἴσαν Il. 22.4, cf. Hdt. 4.3, Ar. Eq. 1306; simply of approach, γυναῖχʼ ὁρῶ στείχουσαν ἡμῶν ἆ. S. OC 312, cf. El. 900; of a woman, ἥτις ἀνδρῶν ἆ. οὐκ ἐλήλυθεν Ar. Eq. 1306; δίφρον ἆ. ἕλκεται πυρός Semon. 7.26: c. dat., S. OC 722: with double Comp., ἕρποντι μᾶλλον ἆσσον Id. Ant. 1210: Sup. ἄσσιστα A. Fr. 6; ἄσιστα IG 5(2).159.17 ( Tegea), Michel 1334 ( Elis, iv B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Comp. ἀσσοτέρω, with or without gen., Od. 19.506, 17.572; later Comp. Adj. ἀσσότερος, = ἐγγύτερος, Arat. 878: Sup. Adv. ἀσσοτάτω AP 9.430 ( Crin.): Sup. Adj. ἀσσότατος ib. 6.345 ( Id.).
the Assyrians, Hdt. 1.193, al.:— Ἀσσυρία, Ion. -ίη (sc. γῆ), ἡ, their country, Id. 2.17, etc.:— Ἀσσύριος, α, ον, as an Adj., Theoc. 2.162, al.; later Ἀσσυρικός, ή, όν, St.Byz., al.
Opp. C. 4.121, 202; cf. ἀσσυτία· ἄλλα ἐπʼ ἄλλοις, Hsch.
not trickling, ἀ. κρύσταλλος hard-frozen ice, dub. l. in S. Fr. 149.4 (prob. εὐπαγῆ).

children.label: II
children.definition: not merely trickling, i.e. gushing, in a stream, A.R. 3.805, Nic. Th. 307.
unsteady, unstable, κινήσεις Phld. Ir. p.26W.; αὖραι AP 10.74 ( Paul.Sil.), cf. Nonn. D. 8.140, al.; διάνοια LXX 3 Ma. 5.39.
not encamped, App. BC 2.74.

unsteady, unstable, ἀστέρες, = πλανῆται, X. Mem. 4.7.5; of persons, ὁ δῆμος -ότατον πρᾶγμα D. 19.136, cf. Ar. Av. 169, Pl. Ly. 214d; of life, ἀ. αἰών E. Or. 981 (lyr.); τὸ ἀ. τοῦ μέλλοντος the uncertainty of . . , Th. 4.62; τῆς συμφορᾶς Id. 3.59; τύχης -ότερον οὐδέν Ph. 2.85. Adv. -τως D.Chr. 4.122.
unweighed, without record of weight, IG 1.121.4, al., Epigr.Gr. 805.
the smooth lobster, Philyll. 13, Arist. HA 526a11, 549b14, Matro Conv. 66, Archestr. Fr. 24.1; ὁ ἐν τοῖς ποταμοῖς ἀ. the river cray-fish, Arist. HA 530a28.

children.label: II
children.definition: hollow of the ear, Poll. 2.85. (By assimilation from ὀστακός, the Att. form acc. to Ath. 3.105b.)
not in drops, i.e. in floods, S. (who has -ῑ in OC 1646, -ῐ 1251), Pl. Phd. 117c.
E. IT 1242 (lyr.), Orph. Fr. 47.
not damp, ἀήρ Plu. Crass. 4.
polypus in the nose, Hsch.
unarmed, unclad, Call. Fr. 266.
weep and sob, Hsch. ( -ύχειν cod.).
courier, Plu. Alex. 18, 2.326f; cf. Armen. astandel ‘wander’.
unsteadiness, inconstancy, Man. 1.19: pl., Vett.Val. 38.3.
not torn by faction, Ἀττική Th. 1.2; στρατός App. Hisp. 72; βίος Eus.Mynd. 26.
not liable to disturbance, νομή Sammelb. 5174 (iv A. D.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: free from faction or party-spirit, Lys. 2.55, Pl. R. 459e, etc.; of forms of government, Arist. Pol. 1302a9. Adv. -τως D.S. 17.54, Herm. in Phdr. p.186A.: Comp., D.C. 52.30: Sup. -ότατα Pl. R. 520d.
to be never at rest, πόλοιο φορὰν . . -έουσαν App.Anth. 3.146.4 (Theon); of the sea, Plu. Crass. 17; βλέμμα ἀστατοῦν Hippiatr. 3.
to be unsettled, to be a wanderer, 1 Ep.Cor. 4.11; to be inconstant, περὶ τοὺς γάμους Vett.Val. 116.30.
= Lat. hastati, Plb. 6.23.1.[changed to ἅ- in Supp.]
never standing still, unresting, τὸ κύκλῳ σῶμα Arist. Metaph. 1073a31; ἄ. τροχός Mesom. Nem. 7. Adv. -τως, φορεῖθαι Ph. 1.181, cf. Vett.Val. 27.1.

unsteady, unstable, τύχη Epicur. Ep. 3p.65U., cf. Phld. Rh. 1.166S. ( Sup.), Ph. 1.230, al., Diog.Oen. 18, Diogenian.Epicur. 2.60, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.103f; of persons, ἄ. τὴν διάνοιαν Onos. 3.3; ἄ. αἰών IG 7.2543; θνητῶν βίος Epigr.Gr. 699, cf. Ph. 1.651; of a house, ruinous, PLond.ined. 2194.
uncertain, θεωρία Plb. 6.57.2.
Act., making it impossible to stand, πόνος, πάθος, Luc. Ocyp. 36, 71.

children.label: II
children.definition: unweighed, IG 1.32 B25, al., Nic. Th. 602.

definition: ἀσταφιδίτης, ου, ὁ, fem. ἀσταφιδ-ῖτις, ιδος,

children.definition: of raisins, ἀσταφιδῖτις ῥώξ bunch of raisins, AP 9.226 ( Zon.).

definition: ἀσταφίς, ίδος, ἡ, sg. as collect. noun,

children.definition: dried grapes, raisins, IG 5(1).1.13 ( Tegea, v B.C.), Hdt. 2.40, Alex. 127.4, etc.: pl., ἡ Ῥόδος ἀσταφίδας [παρέχει] Hermipp. 63.16, cf. X. An. 4.4.9, Arist. HA 595b10; ἀσταφίδος οἶνος raisin-wine, Pl. Lg. 845b: ὀστᾰφίς, v.l. ap. Phot. as in Cratin. 121 (pl.), Nicopho 21; στᾰφίς, Hp. Acut. 64, Theoc. 27.9, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dsc. 4.152, Gal. 11.842, Plin. HN 23.17. ( ἀσταφίς is prob. by assimilation from ὀσταφίς; cf. ἀστακός.)
Diocl. Fr. 123.
without grapes, χῶρος Aus. Ep. 12.24.

definition: ἄσταχυς, υος, ὁ, ( στάχυς with prothetic α):—

children.definition: ear of corn, Il. 2.148, Hdt. 5.92.ζʹ, Call. Cer. 20, etc.: metaph., βοστρύχων ἀστάχυες Philostr. Im. 1.7, cf. Luc. Charid. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: bandage, Gal. 18(1).813.
uncovered, ἀγγεῖον Gal. 17(2).153: of a ship, undecked, Antipho 5.22, cf. Apollod. Poliorc. 185.10; roofless, PGen. 11.7 (iv A. D.); διὰ τὸ ἀ. from their having no shelter, Th. 7.87.

definition: ἀστεγής, f.l. for ἀσταγής, δάκρυ App.Anth. 3.198.

children.definition: without roof, houseless, Ps.-Phoc. 24, LXX Is. 58.7, App. Hisp. 78; unprotected, exposed, Ph. 1.574.

children.label: II
children.definition: στέγω) Act., not holding: metaph., ἄ. χείλεσι unable to keep oneʼs mouth shut, given to prating, LXX Pr. 10.8; στόμα ἄ. ib. 26.28.

definition: ἀστειεύομαι, = sq., Sch. Ar. Ach. 1058, Pax 370, Sch. Arat. 956.

children.definition: write or talk wittily or eloquently, Str. 13.4.11, J. Ap. 2.9, Demetr. Eloc. 149, Plu. Marc. 21; talk speciously, Ph. 2.123:— Act. in St.Byz. s.v. ἄστυ.
clever talking, wit, Arist. Rh.Al. 1436a20 (pl.), M.Ant. 1.7.
with graceful limbs, Heph.Astr. 1.1.

definition: ἀστεῖος, α, ον, also ος, ον Diph. 73: ( ἄστυ):—

children.definition: of the town (but in the literal sense ἀστικός is used).

children.label: II
children.definition: town-bred, polite, Pl. Phd. 116d; opp. ἄγροικος, Plu. Mar. 3; γένοιτʼ ἀστεῖος οἰκῶν ἐν πόλει Alc.Com. 26; charming, Isoc. 2.34.

refined, elegant, witty, διάλεκτον ἀστείαν ὑποθηλυτέραν, opp. ἀνελεύθερον ὑπαγροικοτέραν, Ar. Fr. 685; ἀστεῖόν τι λέξαι Id. Ra. 901; ἀστεῖον λέγεις (where there is a play on the double sense, witty and popular) Id. Nu. 204; ἀ. καὶ δημωφελεῖς οἱ λόγοι Pl. Phdr. 227d; ἀστεῖον εἰπεῖν Com.Anon. 248 Mein., cf. Axiop. 1.14; ἀστειοτάτας ἐπινοίας Ar. Eq. 539; of persons, οἱ ἀ. the wits, Pl. R. 452d; τὰ ἀ. witty sayings, witticisms, Arist. Rh. 1411b21, al. Adv. -ως J. AJ 12.4.4, Plu. Sanit. 2.123f, Luc. Nigr. 13.

pretty, charming, βοσκήματε Ar. Ach. 811; ἑορτή Pl. Grg. 447a; ἀ. καὶ εὐήθης Id. R. 349b, cf. Phdr. 242e, Hp. Ep. 13; ἐστὶ γοῦν ἁπλῆ τις;—ἀστεία μὲν οὖν Anaxil. 21; ἀστεῖόν [ἐστι] ὅτι ἐρυθριᾷς it is charming to see you blush, Pl. Ly. 204c; ἀστεῖον πάνυ εἰ . . Men. Sam. 149.

data.quote: ἐστὶ γοῦν ἁπλῆ τις;—ἀστεία μὲν οὖν

children.label: b
children.definition: ἀ. κέρδος a pretty piece of luck, Ar. Nu. 1064; ἀστεῖος εἶ Diph. 73.

pretty, graceful, LXX Ex. 2.2, al.; οἱ μικροὶ ἀ. καὶ σύμμετροι, καλοὶ δʼ οὔ Arist. EN 1123b7; handsome, LXX Jd. 3.17 (of Eglon): in Comedy, of dainty dishes, κραμβίδιον, κρεΐσκον, Antiph. 6, Alex. 189.

data.quote: οἱ μικροὶ ἀ. καὶ σύμμετροι, καλοὶ δʼ οὔ
